Based on a FIAT model, the car featured marvellously unique stylings by Franco Scaglione, and was equipped with a 1.5L engine tuned by Abarth to 73 BHP. The only example ever produced was later entered in the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance in recent years, winning the Gran Turismo trophy.

gb.subtitle: Excellent handling and controllability combined with cute looks.
gb.description: A 3-door hatchback released in the B-segment to replace Alfa Romeo's previous entry-level model, the 147. The car's name is taken from Milano and Torino (Milan-Turin), two very important places in Alfa Romeo history. The standard power unit is a 1.4L DOHC turbo with the 1.4 Sport model producing 152.9 BHP/23 kgfm, coupled with a 6-speed manual transmission. With a top speed of 133.6 mph and a 0-62.1 mph time of 8.0 seconds, the car has more than just adequate performance for a car of its class.

gb.subtitle: A much-desired Le Mans victory and an incredible 1-2-3 finish: a historic machine that opened the first pages of the legend.
gb.description: In an attempt to make a mark on the racing world, Ford collaborated with Lola Cars to create the Mark I. Completed in 1964, the car was based on the Lola-designed 'Mk6' and was unveiled as the Ford GT. The GT40 name was coined by a reporter who was astounded by its height, at a mere 40 inches from the ground. At the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans, the improved model, the Mark II, achieved a miraculous 1-2-3 finish.

gb.subtitle: The 3rd generation Viper, backed by extreme performance under the SRT brand.
gb.description: The 3rd generation Viper debuted in 2012. The main point of interest for the new model was that it would be released by SRT, Chrysler's high performance brand. While the displacement of the V10 engine remained unchanged at 8.4L, numerous improvements were made to the internals allowing it to produce 640 BHP/83 kgfm. Like previous models, the chassis uses a steel tube frame, though rigidity has been increased by 50%. The highest grade model, the GTS, also includes active suspension.

gb.subtitle: Designed with the future in mind. Overall winner of the 2011 Le Mans 24-hour race.
gb.description: A prototype racing car developed by Audi. Though similar to the diesel-powered R10 and R15, the R18 is different in that it is Audi's first closed body design since 1999's R8C. The engine is less powerful than other recent machines producing only 532.5 BHP but is able to make up for it with extensive weight reduction and the aerodynamic advantages that come with a closed body. In 2011, the car took the overall victory at the Le Mans.

gb.subtitle: The second return of Abarth is the timeless '500'; bold looks and bolder driving performance.
gb.description: A factory tuned model of the FIAT 500, produced by the legendary Italian tuning brand Abarth, who made a comeback in 2007. Equipped with a 1.4L DOHC turbo engine producing 133.1 BHP/21 kgfm and with a lightweight body weighing 1,110 kg, the car is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 7.9 seconds and has a top speed of 127.4 mph. The car also exhibits the indomitable image of an Abarth with big bumpers, side skirts and a roof-end spoiler.

gb.subtitle: The concept supercar with cutting-edge technology and a rotary engine.
gb.description: A concept car celebrating the 50th anniversary of the founding of Mazda. The bullet-shaped body sits on a steel tube space frame and houses a 10A type rotary engine built for the 24 Hours of Spa and producing power in the range of 246.5 BHP. While it had been seen in 3 different body colours, further investigation revealed that it had been the same body repainted each time.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate automobile, which won both the BPR series and the 24 Hours of Le Mans.
gb.description: This racing machine is based on McLaren's first full-scale road car, the F1. At the 1995 24 Hours of Le Mans, the track was plagued with rain for almost the entire day and McLaren managed to pull ahead of open prototype cars who should have had the advantage, claiming overall victory. The winning car No. 59, which had factory support from McLaren, was driven by Yannick Dalmas, Masanori Sekiya, and JJ Lehto.

gb.subtitle: A leading muscle car of the 1970s powered by their own special engine.
gb.description: The representative muscle car of the 1970s. The large firebird decal on the bonnet was extremely popular with young enthusiasts at the time. It was the sister car to the Chevrolet Camaro, but the top grade Trans Am featured a special 6.6L engine that was unavailable on the Camaro, making it the pride of Pontiac.

gb.subtitle: Still popular half a century after its birth. A French Icon of the 1960s.
gb.description: This high-performance model of the Renault 8 was tuned by Amédée Gordini, nicknamed 'The Sorcerer' for his work on engines. This car masterfully utilises the merits of the base 8's design, transforming the unassuming 1,108 cc compact saloon into a hard-boiled touring car. In 1966, the engine was enlarged to 1,300 cc and the transmission changed to a 5-speed unit, further increasing its potential. Thanks to its unique design, this automotive masterpiece has a special place in the hearts of fans even now.

gb.subtitle: The limited edition car that set the lap record for mass-produced front-wheel drives on the Nürburgring.
gb.description: Based on the 3rd generation Mégane 3-door coupé, the Mégane R.S. is factory tuned by Renault Sport. Featuring unique ground effects and a newly developed chassis, the car is able to take corners at speeds that easily crown it as the fastest front-wheel drive. In 2011, the Mégane R.S. Trophy was released. Limited to 500 cars worldwide, it would set a new record for mass-produced front-wheel drive cars at the Nürburgring with a lap time of 8 minutes, 7.97 seconds.

gb.subtitle: The 80-car limited edition model that is positioned as 'The Ultimate Diablo'.
gb.description: Based on the Diablo GT2, a full race car developed for FIA GT Championships, the Diablo GT was detuned and modified for street driving. Its 6L V12 engine produces 567.1 BHP and 64 kgfm of torque. At 1,490 kg, 40 kg lighter than the Diablo SV, the car can reach an amazing top speed of 210 mph.

gb.subtitle: An ultra-popular car built to win the GT Class International Championship title.
gb.description: Until the early 1960s, there was only a vague distinction between racing cars and road cars; and this car is an icon of that era. The 'GTO' of its name indicates it is a GT homologation model. The framework is tubular steel, while its bodywork was made of aluminium. The 3L V12 engine employed 6 carburettors to produce 295.9 BHP. The right-hand drive model produced for the UK market reached the podium on numerous occasions at races throughout the UK.

gb.subtitle: Gran Turismo Award winner. A priceless unrestored example.
gb.description: With a chassis and engine by Ferrari and a body by Pininfarina, the 500 Mondial Pinin Farina Coupe was created for competition in the 1954 Tour de France. While it was unable to compete in the Tour de France as planned, an unrestored original example of this car still exists and won the 'Gran Turismo Award' at the 2012 Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

gb.subtitle: An offshoot model at a glance, but 100% purpose-built on the inside. A monster car producing 394.5 BHP.
gb.description: This homologation model was produced in a run of 200 units to meet Group B regulations. Externally similar to the 308, the wheelbase has actually been increased by 110 mm and the engine converted to a longitudinal mounting, meaning the internals are all different. The 2.8L twin-turbo engine produces 394.5 BHP making it the fastest Ferrari at the time.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate supersport; a front-engine, rear-wheel drive that competed for the highest top speed of its day with the rival Miura.
gb.description: The last Ferrari to use a front-mounted 12-cylinder engine, the 365 GTB/4, aka 'Daytona', made its debut at the 1968 Paris Motor Show. The sleek bodywork designed by Leonardo Fioravanti hides a 4,390 cc V12 DOHC engine. Capable of a top speed of 174 mph, it matched its rival, the Lamborghini Miura, as the fastest car of its time.

gb.subtitle: Smaller and more economical than the Prius. A car that helped to further Hybrid cars in the market.
gb.description: After popularizing hybrid cars with the release of the Prius, Toyota developed the Aqua, a smaller, even more economical hybrid car. The hybrid system is a lightened version of that seen in the 3rd generation Prius. In Japanese standard JC08 mode fuel economy tests, it achieved a maximum of 2.9 l/100 km. Outside of Japan it was released as the Prius C.

gb.subtitle: The incredible monster machine capable of exceeding 233 mph using a special key.
gb.description: The ultimate supersports car. First unveiled in 2005 at the Tokyo Motor Show, the car boasted numbers rarely seen even among supercars: 987.2 BHP and a top speed of 252.9 mph, with a price tag of 1 million Euros. The engine is an 8L W16 design with four turbochargers, connected to a 7-speed DSG. A special key is required in order to engage the top speed mode, allowing the car to travel above 233 mph.

gb.subtitle: Lavish interior and high performance. A high-class supercar that epitomises high quality.
gb.description: Pagani introduced the Huayra in 2011 to replace the Zonda. The monocoque frame uses a combination of carbon and titanium, and features gullwing doors, merging exquisite design with high performance. The AMG 6L V12 twin-turbo engine is mated to a 7-speed sequential transmission and is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.2s and a top speed of 234.9 mph.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance sports coupé with circuit-developed components.
gb.description: This sports coupé uses the same platform as the Genesis luxury sedan. 345 mm shorter than the sedan and with a wheelbase 115 mm shorter, the car achieves excellent agility by combining a front-engine, rear-wheel drive layout with four wheel independent suspension. In 2012, the car received minor changes, increasing engine power output. With a 3.8L V6 producing roughly 345.2 BHP the car achieves performance close to supercar levels.

gb.subtitle: Experience an exquisite sports concept. Car Number 1 of ‘Vision Gran Turismo'.
gb.description: This car marked the opening of the 'Vision Gran Turismo' project. Its elegant form is styled after a large feline on the hunt, and is a hybrid of an aluminium space frame with carbon fibre. At 1,358 kg, the car is relatively light and is equipped with an AMG 5L V8 twin-turbo engine producing 430kW/800Nm (576.9 BHP/81.6 kgfm). The engine sound has also been tuned by specialists making this car as appealing to the ear as it is to the eye.

gb.subtitle: The advanced styling that swept the world has not faded over the years.
gb.description: The original Chevrolet Corvette won numerous races. The Corvette SS, newly designed in a project led by GM engineer Zora Duntov, featured a fuel injection 364.9 BHP 283 engine and had a top speed of 181.4 mph. However, after a major incident in NASCAR, the AMA banned factory racing teams and the project was halted. The Stingray Racer was introduced as the successor to the SS and would go on to win the SCCA Class C modified title in 1959 and 1960.

gb.subtitle: Fast enough to drive on full size circuits: a full race machine with a 6-speed transmission.
gb.description: While racing karts are often seen as an entry point to motorsports, the Shifter Kart is what you might like to call a sub-formula car. With its 125 cc water-cooled 2-stroke engine connected to a 6-speed transmission and front only brakes, the kart can reach a top speed of 124.3 miles. This is a true racing machine that is used to train top drivers.

gb.subtitle: 0-62.1 mph in just 4.1 seconds. The high performance model of the legendary M series.
gb.description: The 3-series coupé and cabriolet models were separated from the line-up to become the 4-series, with this car as the flagship model. While highly appealing for it's beautiful 2-door coupé proportions alone, the real focus of this car is on performance. The engine is a straight six twin-turbo producing 425 BHP/56.1 kgfm. The combination of the active M differential, adaptive M suspension and the M-specific DSC create the ultimate driving experience.

gb.subtitle: Another 'Mercedes-Benz AMG Vision Gran Turismo' ready for competitive racing.
gb.description: A racing version of the Mercedes-Benz AMG Vision Gran Turismo. This car has done away with all the interior comforts to bring the weight down to 1,300 kg and generates more downforce for the circuit with a large fixed rear wing. The power of the AMG 5.5L V8 twin-turbo engine has been increased to 591.7 BHP. The transmission has also been optimised for transmission performance, leaving behind the 7-speed dual-clutch for a full sequential system.

gb.subtitle: A traditional Venturi car with the axial-flow fan and skirts removed from the X2014.
gb.description: The X2014 Series was born from a collaborative 'fan car' project between Red Bull Racing and Gran Turismo. The X2014 Standard, the mid-range model, was developed as a conventional Venturi car. The design reduces air resistance with front and back wheel covers and a glass canopy, and also produces more downforce.

gb.subtitle: A beginner level machine for learning the basics of formula cars.
gb.description: The X2014 Series was born from a collaborative 'fan car' project between Red Bull Racing and Gran Turismo. The X2014 Junior entry-level model combines a compact body with a similarly compact engine producing roughly 246.5 BHP, to create the perfect machine on which to learn the basics of formula driving.

gb.subtitle: Toyota's sports design concept presented at the January 2014 North American International Auto Show.
gb.description: The Toyota FT-1 is a concept model by Toyota's North American design base CALTY Design, which offers a look at one possible direction for the future of Toyota sports car design. The projected dimensions are Length: 4,675 mm, Width: 1,970 mm, Height: 1,225 mm, Wheelbase: 2,740 mm. The design evokes the long tradition of Toyota sports models which started with the Toyota 2000GT.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate road racer that draws its heritage from the glorious touring cars of the '70s.
gb.description: A modern road racer created by the BMW design team. Its exterior has been designed to give an incredible sense of speed even when the car is standing still. The engine is a powerful 3L straight six producing 404kW/680Nm (541.4 BHP/69 kgfm). Considerably light at only 1,180 kg, the car also achieves a perfect 50:50 front to rear weight distribution. This Vision Gran Turismo is a stunning amalgam of BMW's racing heritage and their latest technology.

gb.subtitle: A hybrid concept packed with know-how and spirit gained through motorsports.
gb.description: This Vision Gran Turismo was created by Mitsubishi Motors who have an exceptional track record in races like the Dakar Rally and the World Rally Championship (WRC.) While taking cues from the 'Mitsubishi Concept XR-PHEV' displayed at the 2013 Tokyo Motor Show, the idea has been developed into a spirited racing machine. A plug-in hybrid EV, combining electric motors with a conventional engine, it directs its immense power to all 4 wheels through the S-AWC vehicle dynamics control system.

gb.subtitle: Experience its extreme acceleration performance. A supercar that carries the 'GTI' DNA.
gb.description: The 'GTI Roadster Vision Gran Turismo' is a supercar that carries the DNA of Volkswagen's 'GTI' experience. At its heart is a 3L twin-turbo VR6 TSI engine producing 502 BHP/67 kgfm. That power is directed through a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission to both front and back wheels for unbeatable traction and acceleration.

gb.subtitle: The most aggressive sportscar in Subaru history, that is still controllable as well as enjoyable.
gb.description: The 'SUBARU VIZIV GT Vision Gran Turismo' is Subaru's ultimate sports car, continuing with their concept of 'VIZIV', Vision for Innovation. The car uses carbon materials throughout the body and weighs 1,380 kg. With a special 2L horizontally-opposed engine and high powered electric motors, the combined drive system produces a maximum 591.7 BHP with a maximum torque of 800Nm (82 kgfm).

gb.subtitle: The Prototype racing car that fought in the 24 Hours of Le Mans and WEC utilising a hybrid system.
gb.description: The TS030 Hybrid was developed for competition in the 2012 World Endurance Championship. The 'THS-R' powertrain was developed in a joint effort between Toyota's production hybrid development team and the Higashi-Fuji Technical Center's motorsports division using a newly designed V8 engine. It was unfortunately forced to retire in its debut race at the 24 Hours of Le Mans but it took 3 victories over the season, finishing 2nd in the rankings.

gb.subtitle: A true performance machine with class, a car that gives us a glimpse of future Aston Martins.
gb.description: This Vision Gran Turismo design was born from the minds of Marek Reichman's design team at Aston Martin. The car was developed in the same processes as production cars at the company's headquarters in Gaydon, Warwickshire. The engine is an 800 BHP (799.8 BHP) V12 twin turbo. The DP-100 also serves as a pilot model for Aston Martin technologies and designs of the future.

gb.subtitle: The FT-1 design concept upgraded to a pure racing sports car.
gb.description: The FT-1 Vision Gran Turismo is a racing version of Toyota's FT-1 sports design concept, created by their North American design base CALTY Design. The design is based on extensive use of both data and experience, featuring oversized fenders, an enlarged air intake, and a large rear wing as well as front canards.

gb.subtitle: Experience rocket-like speed produced by laser pulse shock waves!
gb.description: Chaparral is a legendary brand which has created a number of unique race cars, and the 2X is unlike anything ever seen before. The driver is encapsulated in the carbon fibre body, lying head first as if floating several centimetres off the track surface. The car is powered by an unprecedented laser pulse system which uses the rapid expansion of air to create both thrust and downforce.

gb.subtitle: Power exceeding 2,500 horsepower and cornering capabilities of a jet fighter. An extreme machine for only the chosen few.
gb.description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The 'X' is an extreme model reserved only for those who are deemed fit to drive it, as it increases the total system output to 2,465.5 BHP.

gb.subtitle: A race spec Clubman able to reach 0-62.1 mph in just 3.5 seconds, with a top speed of 180.2 mph.
gb.description: This Vision Gran Turismo brings us the visage of a MINI built to race. With a 1,050 kg lightweight body and 389.5 BHP of power, the car is able to achieve a 0-62.1 mph time of just 3.5 seconds. The drive system powers all four wheels. With its low silhouette lying almost flat on the ground and wheels edged out to their very limit, the car is able to achieve the excellent go-kart like handling that MINIs are famed for, making for an incredible driving experience.

gb.subtitle: A lightweight racing version of the visionary near-future single-seater concept.
gb.description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The GTS-R is the racing version of the Tomahawk. A special racing suit is also provided to help the driver withstand the immense G-forces possible in this vehicle.

gb.subtitle: Controlling the massive power of the over-1,000 horsepower V10 Engine and compressed air unit with near-future technology.
gb.description: This is a car of the future combining uncompromising, unrestricted performance with awe-inspiring design. A mid-engine, four-wheel drive single seater, its body is made from cutting edge composite materials. The engine is a 1,000 horsepower 6.98L V10 supported by a pneumatic sub unit. The 'S' is a more realistic version of the Tomahawk, with considerations for open road driving. However, using the car to its full potential will require near superhuman reflexes.

gb.subtitle: A jewel of a car containing both the tradition and future of Alpine.
gb.description: A single-seater sports car designed by celebrated French brand Alpine for the players of Gran Turismo. Its style is based on the Alpine philosophy of 'speed and excitement, embodied in style' while at the same time being an homage to classic Alpines. This revolutionary vehicle bridges the gap between the road and the circuit, and the virtual and reality.

gb.subtitle: Experience pure steering response in a car that generates powerful downforces directly from its body panels.
gb.description: The PEUGEOT Vision Gran Turismo was born from the minds of the design team of Peugeot and the engineers of Peugeot Sport. With a height of just 1 m, the body hugs the ground and together with its 3.2L V6 turbo engine producing an unrelenting 875ch (874.8 BHP) you can see that this car was developed with a singular focus on driving.

gb.subtitle: A jewel of a car containing both the tradition and future of Alpine.
gb.description: A single-seater sports car designed by celebrated French brand Alpine for the players of Gran Turismo. Its style is based on the Alpine philosophy of 'speed and excitement, embodied in style' while at the same time being an homage to classic Alpines. This revolutionary vehicle bridges the gap between the road and the circuit, and the virtual and reality.

gb.subtitle: High performance made possible with a V8 engine and electrical motor. A GT machine packed with the motorsport passion of Asia.
gb.description: The INFINITI CONCEPT Vision Gran Turismo was born from the Infiniti premium car brand under the philosophy of 'designing a pure INFINITI GT car'. The designers of the car aimed to create a full racing machine while also attempting to create a seductive racing language for Infiniti.

gb.subtitle: A fusion of speed and elegance, born from the spirit of an unrelenting challenger.
gb.description: The Mazda LM55 Vision Gran Turismo was designed by Mazda as a vision of the future, aiming for total victory at the 24 Hours of Le Mans. The car's dynamic silhouette was inspired by Mazda's KODO design philosophy and its front grille features a reinterpretation of the front end design used across all Mazda models of recent years.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance luxury car prepared as a 'beautifully wrapped gift.'
gb.description: A Vision Gran Turismo model from the famous Italian design house. The car's name stems from the Latin 'xenium,' meaning 'gift for the guest' and the design 'wraps up' the driver and engine in carbon fibre and aluminium tape. Behind the cockpit sits a V10 engine, while 2 electric motors sit in the front. The chassis can be set to 4 different configurations to tackle all terrain conditions.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance luxury car prepared as a 'beautifully wrapped gift.'
gb.description: A Vision Gran Turismo model from the famous Italian design house. The car's name stems from the Latin 'xenium,' meaning 'gift for the guest' and the design 'wraps up' the driver and engine in carbon fibre and aluminium tape. Behind the cockpit sits a V10 engine, while 2 electric motors sit in the front. The chassis can be set to 4 different configurations to tackle all terrain conditions.

gb.subtitle: This lightweight midship sport car embodies Honda's 'Power of Dreams' philosophy.
gb.description: The 'Honda Sports Vision Gran Turismo' is a 2-seater coupé born from the collaborative efforts of the Honda design team and 'Gran Turismo'. Honda's 'Human Centred Design' direction is manifested in this car which uses human-centric package design. The car also strives to create the strong, exciting proportions that one would expect from a sports car.

gb.subtitle: A tribute to the legendary manufacturer. Zagato's Vision Gran Turismo.
gb.description: This Vision Gran Turismo was created by Carrozzeria Zagato, taking inspiration from the IsoRivolta, a GT car from the 1960s produced by sports car brand ISO. This car takes the DNA of the IsoRivolta, which saw extensive use in motorsports, and rebuilds it using the latest design techniques and technologies.

gb.subtitle: A beautiful high performance machine for participation in the Nürburgring 24 hour race.
gb.description: The Lexus LF-LC GT 'Vision Gran Turismo' is a dream car designed by Lexus in view of competition in the Super GT and the 24 Hours of Nürburgring. Based on the LF-LC luxury coupé concept, this new idea was born from the Lexus design philosophy by CALTY DESIGN combined with a more practical approach taken from Lexus Racing.

gb.subtitle: Specs and appearance befitting a Supersport. Expanding the possibilities of the GTI.
gb.description: The 'GTI Supersport Vision Gran Turismo' takes DNA from the legends in Volkswagen's GTI history to create a both technically and visually refined supercar. The body, which evokes the image of the iconic Golf, mounts a 502 BHP VR6 TSI engine. With a lowered centre of gravity utilising lightweight parts, the car provides a superior handling experience.

gb.subtitle: Front-wheel drive prototype hybrid racer designed by Ben Bowlby.
gb.description: In spring 2014, Nissan announced that they would be entering a car bearing the GT-R badge in the 24 Hours of Le Mans. This GT-R LM NISMO featured a revolutionary front-engine front-wheel drive construction. The carbon fibre body was designed by Ben Bowlby, the man behind the DeltaWing and ZEOD RC, and is equipped with a 3L V6 twin-turbo engine and energy recovery system. Weighing the minimum 880 kg, it competed for overall victory.

gb.subtitle: A well balanced, high performance car that immediately became a familiar presence on race podiums.
gb.description: A pure racing machine which began competing in GT races in 2012, continuing the glorious track record built up by its predecessors the DBR9 and DBRS9. Built off of the V8 Vantage body, the fenders have been widened and a large rear wing has been added, while the weight has been shaved down to just 1,250 kg. The V12 engine has been tuned to 591.7 BHP/71 kgfm and mated to an XTrac sequential transmission with paddle shifters. The car would go on to perform spectacularly at circuits around the world.

gb.subtitle: An homage to the Type 57 Tank, this Vision Gran Turismo represents the glorious history of Bugatti.
gb.description: This machine was envisioned as an homage to cars of Bugatti's racing past. Designers and engineers came together to create the vehicle using the latest technologies and aerodynamic theory. With 4 turbochargers, the W16 engine produces an unbelievable 1230kW/1580Nm (1,649.9 BHP/161.1 kgfm) which makes it possible to reach speeds of over 248.5 mph (250mph) in four places on Circuit de la Sarthe, the home of the 24 Hours of Le Mans. The power bestowed upon the car allows it to reach a top speed of 278.1 mph (278mph).

gb.subtitle: An extreme monster machine embodying the passion and future of Hyundai's ‘N’.
gb.description: Created to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Hyundai, this model also represents the passion of Hyundai's 'N' high performance division. Powered by hydrogen fuel cells and super capacitors which store energy from the regenerative brakes, the car achieves a total power output of 650kW (871.8 BHP) through the electric motors on each wheel. Thanks to its compact and lightweight fuel cell stacks and CFRP monocoque frame, the car weighs just 972 kg.

gb.subtitle: 1,000 cars sold out almost instantly. The limited launch edition of the 4C, with supercar performance.
gb.description: Alfa Romeo's first mass production mid-engine sports car, released in 2013. The car takes much from the stylings of the classic Tipo 33/2 Stradale. The 1,742 cc 4-cylinder engine producing 236.7 BHP/35.7 kgfm is combined with an extremely light body, allowing the car to accelerate to 62.1 mph in 4.5 seconds with a top speed of 160.3 mph. The 'launch edition' was a special edition model, limited to 1000 cars worldwide.

gb.subtitle: The 6th generation Mustang marks the model’s 50th anniversary. Ford's tour de force is sold in 120 countries around the world.
gb.description: In 2014, the 50th anniversary of its debut and with its market larger than ever, the 6th generation Ford Mustang was released after an intensive development cycle by Ford. The car featured more aggressive styling and new four-wheel independent suspension. While there are many models in the line-up, the Mustang GT is the one for fans of the series, featuring the signature V8 engine.

gb.subtitle: Even beginners can experience dynamic driving performance with a range of electronic aids.
gb.description: The RC F is a high performance coupé announced by Lexus at the 2014 Detroit Auto Show. The engine is a refined version of the 5L V8 from the IS F, producing 449.7 BHP/53 kgfm, a 32.5 BHP/1.5 kgfm improvement over the base engine. This is combined with an 8-speed automatic transmission with paddle shifters. Excluding the LFA, this is the most sports oriented model in the history of the Lexus line-up.

gb.subtitle: The GTI version of the 7th-generation Golf ups its handling performance.
gb.description: Debuting in 2012, the 7th generation Volkswagen Golf was built on a new platform allowing for various improvements. Most notably, handling was improved with the use of the 'XDS', an electronically controlled differential locking mechanism that works much the same as an LSD, 'DCC' adaptive chassis control, and progressive steering. These improvements increase stability as well as allowing the car to take corners at much higher speeds.

gb.subtitle: The next generation GT Concept with racing car aerodynamics.
gb.description: This Vision Gran Turismo portrays a not too distant vision of the future for Nissan, realized through the collaboration of young group of British designers and Japanese engineers. The powertrain combines a V6 twin-turbo with 3 electric motors to create the performance hybrid FR-4WD system. Using active suspension to take full advantage of its aerodynamic prowess, the car is always ready to unleash its full performance unto the driver at any moment.

gb.subtitle: The powerful GT3 machine that won the Nürburgring 24 Hour Race immediately after its debut.
gb.description: The production model Audi R8 received a full model change in 2015 and along with it came an updated R8 LMS FIA GT3 specification racing car. Along with major improvements to safety and aerodynamics, the transmission and traction control were replaced with newly developed systems. Just after its announcement, the R8 LMS made its racing debut in the Nürburgring 24 Hours where it took overall victory.

gb.subtitle: A concept car which carries on Toyota’s tradition of light weight sportscars.
gb.description: With its concept of providing 'perfect control in an entry model, allowing the driver to enjoy interacting with the car in its everyday use', Toyota introduced the S-FR lightweight sportscar in the autumn of 2015 at the Tokyo Motor Show. The design captures the essence of the classic Toyota Sports 800 updated for modern tastes.

gb.subtitle: Ford's Sport Technology on full display in this late-model, compact performance car.
gb.description: The Focus ST, the sports model of the Focus line, has been a popular choice since its debut in 1998. The ST stands for 'Sports Technology.' While the 3rd generation ST features a smaller engine than the previous model, the power has been increased by 24.7 BHP for a total of 246.5 BHP. This model caters for the hardcore enthusiast with such features as the full six-speed manual transmission, in a market where many have moved over to 2 pedal systems.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate model of the pure high performance sportscar and heir to the lineage of the famed E-type.
gb.description: This sports car was introduced in 2012 as a spiritual successor to the classic E-type which had ceased production in 1975. At first, it was only available as a convertible, but just over one year later a coupé model was added. This model is the high-performance F-type R Coupé that was announced at the same time. The supercharged 5L V8 engine produces 542.4 BHP and is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 4.2s, though its top speed is limited to 186.4 mph.

gb.subtitle: Only 3 cars ever produced. A car commemorating the 50th anniversary of Lamborghini.
gb.description: The Veneno was a special limited edition model to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the founding of Lamborghini. Only 3 were ever sold. Based on the Aventador and using the same chassis and powertrain, the engine output was increased to 739.6 BHP, while its weight was reduced with improvements such as a carbon fibre monocoque. This made the Veneno 125 kg lighter than the Aventador at 1,450 kg.

gb.subtitle: The wide and low 990 kg model of the 4th generation Roadster.
gb.description: The 4th generation 'ND' Roadster was first unveiled in April 2014 at the New York Auto Show. Along with its size, the body styling which uses a wide and low design with graceful curves received worldwide praise when it was revealed in September the same year. Pre-orders began in March 2015. The most basic trim level, the S grade features simplified equipment and is also the only model weighing less than 1t with a kerb weight of 990 kg.

gb.subtitle: 192.6 mph top speed. A supersport personifying the mission of Mercedes.
gb.description: The AMG GT is a supercar announced in 2014 by Mercedes-Benz. Under its characteristic long-nose stylings, lies a rigid aluminium space frame, carrying the M178 3,982 cc V8 twin-turbo engine. The 'S' is a high performance model that increases the power output to 502 BHP, and matches its performance with stiffer suspension and wider tyres.

gb.subtitle: The truly final model, bringing a close to their long history in the WRC.
gb.description: Limited to 1000 cars, this is the final model of the Lancer Evolution X. The 'X' does not appear anywhere on the body however, discreetly indicating that this in fact may be the final Lancer Evolution. Based on the 5-speed manual GSR model, the engine produces 308.7 BHP/43 kgfm now equipped with sodium filled exhaust valve stems. This version also includes the 'high-performance package' with Bilstein dampers and Eibach springs.

gb.subtitle: The ultra high performance Charger that set a world speed record.
gb.description: This car offers the most extreme performance of all the models of the 3rd generation Charger, which originally debuted in 2005. Developed by Chrysler's high performance development team SRT, the Hellcat adds a supercharger to the 6.2L V8 Hemi engine to produce an astronomical 707.1 BHP/81 kgfm. Able to go from 0-60mph in 3.7 seconds and with a top speed of 203.8 mph, this was, for a time, the fastest 4-door sedan in the world.

gb.subtitle: A model stemming from the Impreza in pursuit of speed and the fun of driving.
gb.description: Announced in autumn 2013, the Subaru WRX is a mid-class saloon, now independent from the Impreza line. Using almost the same platform as the Levorg, the WRX has been significantly reinforced. The high powered STI edition features even better performance, with newly developed suspension and a refined version of the EJ20, now producing 303.7 BHP/43 kgfm.

gb.subtitle: The new generation 86, a prime example of 21st-century compact FR philosophy.
gb.description: The Toyota 86 is the Toyota version of the compact front-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car developed jointly with Subaru. The front-midship mounted naturally aspirated 2L DOHC boxer engine produces 197.2 BHP/20 kgfm. Many new parts were designed and developed specifically for this vehicle, resulting in direct handling that makes the driver feel at one with the car. This is truly a new generation lightweight sports car that puts car fans first.

gb.subtitle: The 'hot' version of the 5th generation Polo uses an advanced engine setup.
gb.description: A high performance version of the 5th gen Polo, Volkswagen's masterpiece compact car. Originally equipped with a 1.4L engine with a super- and turbocharger, the 2014 model changed to a 1.8L turbocharged unit, achieving both high output at 189.3 BHP and better fuel efficiency. With performance befitting the GTI badge, this car is a worthy representative of B-segment hot hatches.

gb.subtitle: The openness of a motorcycle with the horizontal Gs of a 4-wheeled car: A new driving sensation is born.
gb.description: The 'Honda Project 2&4 powered by RC213V' was born from a collaborative effort between Honda's design team and Gran Turismo. The design combines the 212 BHP Honda RC213V-S engine and an ultralight body weighing 405 kg to create a new kind of mobility with the openness and agility of a motorcycle and the handling and lateral G feeling of a 4-wheeled vehicle.

gb.subtitle: Refined driving performance on the road or on the track.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original takes Aston Martin's mid-range 'Vantage' sports car and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. The lively V8 engine's straight line speed and the excellent cornering behaviour inherent in the car's ideal weight distribution make for a well-balanced racing machine.

gb.subtitle: The Ferrari with the highest down-force ever and winner of the FIA-GT European Championship Title.
gb.description: The 458 Italia GT3 is a GT3 regulation race car developed from the 458 Italia. The front bumper is set lower acting as an air dam, and a large rear wing has also been added. While it shares the same power unit as the road model, a restrictor has been fitted limiting the power to 542.4 BHP. Debuting in 2011, it would take the FIA-GT3 European championship title the same year.

gb.subtitle: The 6th generation Mustang marks model’s 50th anniversary. Ford's tour de force is sold in 120 countries around the world.
gb.description: The Mustang Gr.3 is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.3 regulations. The fenders have been stretched out to fit wider tyres and large air outlets have been added to the rear to effectively route air outwards. This muscle car finds its strengths in the stability of its long wheelbase and its unbeatable top speed.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance sports coupé with circuit-developed components.
gb.description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. With its over 2,800 mm long wheelbase, the car achieves both high stability and a powerful downforce from its large floor surface area. The V6 engine, though naturally aspirated, still produces over 493.1 BHP. It's a balanced machine that can handle both corners and straights.

gb.subtitle: The 2017 model polished even 'deeper' in its revision.
gb.description: Nissan's 'multi-performance' R35 GT-R has been modified for Gr.4 competition in this Gran Turismo Original. The four-wheel drive system provides handling stability, and other endurance racing items like the fog lamps make it a perfect machine for the long run.

gb.subtitle: Ferrari’s first hybrid car, built with the same materials and processes as an F1 racing machine.
gb.description: One of Ferrari's special models, the history of which includes the F40, F50 and Enzo Ferrari. Made with the same materials and methods as Ferrari's F1 cars, it features a carbon monocoque shell equipped with a version of the F12berlinetta's 6.3L V12 engine tuned to 788 BHP, and also utilises the HY-KERS hybrid system. The car boasts a 0-62.1 mph time of under 3 seconds, a 0-124.3 mph time of under 7 seconds and an incredible top speed of 217.5 mph.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance sports coupé with circuit-developed components.
gb.description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Though externally appearing to be a touring car, it possesses a number of features that put it closer to Gr.3 like its paddle shift transmission. In the real world, the Genesis is a popular choice for drifting, and this Gr.4 edition is just as adept, it's not just for races.

gb.subtitle: The 6th generation Mustang marks model’s 50th anniversary. Ford's tour de force is sold in 120 countries around the world.
gb.description: The Mustang Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. Thanks to the high stability of the original, this touring car is an excellent choice for beginners. The exterior also stands out for its use of the classic Ford racing stripe.

gb.subtitle: 1,000 cars sold out almost instantly. The limited launch edition of the 4C, with supercar performance.
gb.description: The 4C Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo original model based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sports car, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.4 standards. It is essentially a tuned version of the base model, so while it is somewhat lacking in power, this cornering monster uses the innate agility of its small frame to gain an advantage on track.

gb.subtitle: The 2017 model polished even 'deeper' in its revision.
gb.description: In 2016, the Nissan GT-R received its most drastic facelift upgrade since its original release in 2007. The exterior balances air resistance, downforce and cooling performance. Meanwhile, the 565.1 BHP producing 3.8L V6 twin-turbo engine and improved 6-speed dual clutch transmission provide smoother acceleration and better cornering performance. These 'deeper' evolutions make this a prime example of the character of Japanese sports cars.

gb.subtitle: Kept simple but with more power. The sports grade model of the 3rd generation TT.
gb.description: The 3rd generation TT debuted in 2014. While still carrying the same concepts as the first two generations, the car was given a fiercer appearance with a larger single-frame grille and R8 style headlights. The TTS model is the leading sports model of the line-up and is equipped with the 4-cylinder turbo 2.0 TFSI engine tuned up to 309.7 BHP/38 kgfm (for the German domestic model.) With a 6-speed manual transmission linked to the quattro system, the car offers an incredible ride.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate hot hatch based on the 3rd generation A-Class.
gb.description: This high-performance model was added to the 3rd generation A-Class line-up one year after its debut. The 2L turbo engine, tuned by AMG, produces 355 BHP/45 kgfm. The car goes from 0-62.1 mph in 4.6 seconds and hits its speed limiter at 155.3 mph. To keep this power under control, the car utilises a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission directed through a four-wheel drive system. Brakes and suspension components have also been upgraded.

gb.subtitle: Continuing the aesthetic style of the Gallardo, this 4WD supercar is lighter and more powerful.
gb.description: The Huracán was announced in 2014 to replace the Gallardo. Construction changed from an aluminium space frame to an aluminium and carbon hybrid, which allowed for a 50% gain in rigidity and 10% less weight. The midship-mounted engine is a 5.2L V10 producing 601.6 BHP/57 kgfm. This power is directed through a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission and through the Haldex 5 AWD system to the ground.

gb.subtitle: A popular special model that gained high praise, not only for its specs but for uniqueness and quality.
gb.description: A premium compact announced in 2009. Though it uses the same platform as the C3, the car carries the DS brand and features unique stylings, as well as a high standard of quality. The DS 3 Racing is a special model sold to celebrate its entry in the WRC, starting 2011. Developed by Citroën Racing, the engine has received a considerable increase in power, as well as modifications to the chassis.

gb.subtitle: The 3rd generation Atenza (Mazda 6) with a beautifully flowing body and SKYACTIV technology.
gb.description: The 3rd generation Atenza featured Mazda's SKYACTIV-D diesel engine. Nicknamed XD (cross-d) it was produced in 3 trim levels with the L package being the highest grade. With environmentally-oriented improvements such as idling stop and i-ELOOP regenerative braking, the vehicles equipped with SKYACTIV-D were able to achieve a fuel economy of 4.5 l/100 km in 'JC08 mode' testing.

gb.subtitle: The MP4-12C further evolved as a luxury supercar.
gb.description: The 650S is a McLaren supercar announced in 2014. The 3.8L V8 twin-turbo engine from previous models has been tuned to 641 BHP/69 kgfm to live up to its name. Combined with a 7-speed dual clutch transmission for super smooth shifting, the car goes from 0 to 62.1 mph in 3.0 seconds with a 400 m time of 10.5 seconds, and a top speed of 206.9 mph.

gb.subtitle: Refined driving performance on the road or on the track.
gb.description: The 'Baby Aston' was developed to offer the best performance possible. While this front-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car originally debuted in 2005 equipped with a 4.3L V8 engine, in 2008 engine displacement was increased to 4.7L for increased performance. The Vantage S was a special high-performance model introduced in 2011. Along with a high output engine, it also featured stiffer suspension and a more aggressive steering ratio for sharper sports driving.

gb.subtitle: A unique car with a double-bubble rear roof.
gb.description: Gaining widespread attention after its unveiling as a concept car at the 2007 Frankfurt Motor Show, the Peugeot RCZ was released to the public in 2010 barely unchanged from its concept format. In 2015 the GT Line model was added, featuring a new front grille and dual exhaust pipes, as well as 19-inch wheels and a new red-stitched black leather interior for a much sportier look.

gb.subtitle: Dallara has taken the best elements of the Huracán and enhanced their competition potential for this GT3 machine.
gb.description: Unveiled in January 2015, the Huracán GT3 is, as its name suggests, a racing version of the Huracán built to FIA GT3 specifications. While the body is made from an aluminium and carbon fibre hybrid construction like the road car, the body width has been increased. The car also uses numerous parts to improve aerodynamics, which give it a new, more aggressive appearance than the road car.

gb.subtitle: The much anticipated concept GT race machine.
gb.description: Introduced at the 2015 Tokyo Motor Show, the S-FR Racing Concept was a racing version of the Toyota S-FR. Fender width was increased by 20 mm each side and a large air outlet was added on the engine bonnet. A large spoiler and other ground effects have also been added, giving the once cute S-FR Concept the image of a full GT racing machine.

gb.subtitle: A dream machine made to be the pinnacle of race cars and a true Bugatti.
gb.description: A version of the Bugatti Vision Gran Turismo concept car, developed in a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Bugatti, modified for Gr.1 regulations. The excellent stability resulting the wide track and four-wheel drive system of the base model makes for a relatively easy-going race car.

gb.subtitle: An extreme monster machine embodying the passion and future of Hyundai's ‘N’.
gb.description: Originally born from a collaboration between Hyundai and Gran Turismo, the N 2025 Vision Gran Turismo has been modified to meet Gr.1 regulations in this original model. According to Gr.1 rules, the variable wing has been fixed in place. The drivetrain carries over the four-wheel drive setup, allowing this car to perform as if it were glued to the road.

gb.subtitle: A fusion of speed and elegance, born from the spirit of an unrelenting challenger.
gb.description: A Gr.1 modified version of the LM55 Vision Gran Turismo, Mazda's vision of a modern rotary prototype car. This car has the superb cornering characteristics that one would expect from a Mazda, along with the strong traction provided by the four-wheel drive system. Quickly darting around corners and dashing down the straights, it is truly the modern vision of a 'rotary rocket.'

gb.subtitle: Lose yourself in the resonating exhaust of the ferocious and sexy beast.
gb.description: The 650S GT3 is an FIA-GT3 regulation ready vehicle developed from the McLaren 650S supercar. While it uses the same 3.8L V8 twin-turbo engine, it has been detuned to meet GT3 regulations, producing the same 493.1 BHP as the MP4-12C GT3. It also features numerous endurance oriented improvements across the car. The 2015 650S GT3 achieved victory at GT Asia the same year and the Bathurst 12 Hour at the start of 2016.

gb.subtitle: The 7th generation Corvette, worthy of the legendary 'Stingray' badge.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the C7, the final front-engine Corvette, to meet Gr.3 regulations. The exterior features large fog lamps for endurance racing, and an unusually shaped rear wing. The acceleration of the large displacement V8 and the agile cornering ability of the front-midship layout result in a textbook example of what an 'FR' race car should be.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate model of the pure high performance sportscar and heir to the lineage of the famed E-type.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Jaguar's new-generation F-type coupé has been modified to meet Gr.3 rules. This race car retains the beauty of the original design, while adding aggressive aesthetics such as the wide fenders. Another standout feature is the swan-neck wing which juts out from the tail lights, providing strength and downforce.

gb.subtitle: The truly final model, bringing a close to their long history in the WRC.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of Mitsubishi's high performance sedan, the Lancer Evolution Final Edition, modified for Gr.3 regulations. This function-first design has removed all unnecessary embellishments. Slits on the front fenders push turbulent air out from the wheel well and numerous winglets inside the fender reshape the air moving across the whole body.

gb.subtitle: A model stemming from the Impreza in pursuit of speed and the fun of driving.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Subaru's high performance WRX sedan has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations. In order to reduce size of the front cross-sectional area, the lower chassis has been cut down and car height lowered as far as possible. Thanks to its diffuser style front splitter and 2-level rear wing, this 4-door sedan produces more downforce than a coupé.

gb.subtitle: The FT-1 design concept upgraded to a pure racing sports car.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of Toyota's new-generation racing concept, the FT-1 Vision Gran Turismo. The base FT-1 has been fitted with wide fenders, a large rear wing and a front splitter to transform it into a cutting edge race car.

gb.subtitle: A GT Machine of the 'World Series by Renault', reborn with NISMO tuning.
gb.description: Based on Renault Sport's one-make race machine, the R.S.01, the Renault Sport R.S.01 GT3 was developed for use in FIA-GT championships. This model features numerous changes to conform with FIA (Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile) GT3 regulations. The power output has been limited and brake materials have been changed, in addition to 50 kg of ballast and completely revised ground effects.

gb.subtitle: A concept car for the virtual world, developed in collaboration with Citroën.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original model, this is a Gr.3 regulation version of the 'GT by Citroën', itself born from a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Citroën. Different from the stock model, the aggressive exterior, which evokes images of fighting robots, should leave a lasting impression on anyone who sees it. It also has excellent aerodynamics with a number of winglets across the body, providing a powerful downforce.

gb.subtitle: Experience its extreme acceleration performance. A supercar that carries the 'GTI' DNA.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 specification version of the GTI Vision Gran Turismo, itself produced in a collaboration between Volkswagen and Gran Turismo. Major improvements have been made to downforce with a longer front splitter and an enlarged rear wing.

gb.subtitle: Experience pure steering response in a car that generates powerful downforces directly from its body panels.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a Gr.3 modified version of the PEUGEOT Vision Gran Turismo which was created in a collaboration between Peugeot and Gran Turismo. To produce extra downforce, the front splitter and rear diffuser have been enlarged, and a swan-neck wing has been added to the rear.

gb.subtitle: 1,000 cars sold out almost instantly. The limited launch edition of the 4C, with supercar performance.
gb.description: The 4C Gr.3 is a Gran Turismo original model based on Alfa Romeo's new generation midship sports car, the 4C, modified to meet Gr.3 standards. Careful attention has been placed on the stability and aerodynamics with the wheelbase lengthened by 110 mm, and the front overhang by roughly 30 mm. The 4C has been reborn as a race car able to handle a great amount of power, while still retaining the excellent cornering ability of the original.

gb.subtitle: A jewel of a car containing both the tradition and future of Alpine.
gb.description: A single-seater sports car designed by celebrated French brand Alpine for the players of Gran Turismo. Its style is based on the Alpine philosophy of 'speed and excitement, embodied in style' while at the same time being an homage to classic Alpines. This revolutionary vehicle bridges the gap between the road and the circuit, and the virtual and reality.

gb.subtitle: A mid-engine rear-wheel drive version of the Tomahawk for Gr.1 competition.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo original model, this is a Gr.1 regulation version of the Dodge SRT Tomahawk Vision Gran Turismo that was created in a collaboration between Gran Turismo and Dodge. The car features new aerodynamic parts to make sure the car's over 700 horsepower is fully transferred to the ground. These include an extended front splitter and rear wing created by Dodge Design as well as 4 canards.

gb.subtitle: A supersport which carries both the history and driving DNA of Mercedes.
gb.description: The SLS supercar is an homage to historic Mercedes designs. This version modified for Gr.4 is a Gran Turismo Original. With its GT3 style roll cage, long nose and short deck, its dimensions are similar to the 300SL and provide good cornering stability. The straight line speed provided by its conventional V8 engine should not be ignored either.

gb.subtitle: A special M4 designed as a safety car.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original safety car is based on BMW's new generation high performance M4 coupé. The exterior takes the 'M Performance Edition' and adds a number of specially designed parts, including a lip spoiler, bonnet pins, grill garnishes, rear spoiler and diffuser.

gb.subtitle: 192.6 mph top speed. A supersport personifying the mission of Mercedes.
gb.description: The AMG GT is a supercar announced in 2014 by Mercedes-Benz. Under its characteristic long-nose styling lies a rigid aluminium space frame, carrying the M178 3,982 cc V8 twin-turbo engine. The 'S' is a high performance model that increases the power output to 502 BHP. This particular model has been modified as a Safety Car.

gb.subtitle: A hit model that made a successful comeback, setting the commercial front-wheel drive lap record on the Nürburgring Nordschleife.
gb.description: The Civic Type R is a sports model that has continued to excite enthusiasts around the world since its debut in 1997. The new car was developed from the 9th gen. European market 5-door model, undergoing rigorous wind-tunnel and circuit testing in the pursuit of performance. On the Nürburgring Nordschleife, the car ran a timed lap of just 7 minutes and 50.63 seconds, setting a new record for consumer model front-wheel drives.

gb.subtitle: Lightweight, small, fun and fast. A chic and realistic sports compact.
gb.description: The 208 GTi is the sports model of Peugeot's 208, a mainstream compact car. The body is smaller than the previous 207 and, through an overhaul of construction and materials across the car, is over 100 kg lighter. With a top speed of 142.9 mph and a 0-62.1 mph time of 6.8 seconds, this car sits at the forefront of the hot hatches.

gb.subtitle: The R.S.01, entering the battlefield of sports car racing.
gb.description: In summer 2014, Renault Sport released the R.S.01 as the new machine for one-make racing, taking the place of the Mégane Trophy. Though 4,170 mm long and 2,000 mm wide, the body weighs just 1,100 kg. This light frame is powered by a V6 twin-turbo engine producing 542.4 BHP. The car offers all anyone could ask for in a race car, with all of Renault Sport's extensive know-how present in the aerodynamics and cooling parts.

gb.subtitle: The sports grade model of the 6th generation Camaro, with the 6.2 litre LT1 engine.
gb.description: The 6th generation of the Camaro debuted in 2015. The exterior retains the retro-modern concept of the previous generation but the interior structure is an all-new design. Based on the new 'Alpha' platform, aluminium is used throughout the car for a 28% increase in rigidity and a 90 kg decrease in weight. The SS sports grade model is equipped with a 6.2L V8 engine, with 20-inch wheels and Brembo brakes as standard.

gb.subtitle: The car driven by Kazunori Yamauchi in the 2016 Nürburgring 24 hour race.
gb.description: BMW announced that they would be competing with this M6 GT3 in the FIA GT3 category starting 2016. At 5m long and 2m wide, it is somewhat larger than its racing predecessor, the compact Z4 GT3. Gran Turismo series producing Kazunori Yamauchi competed in the Nürburgring 24 Hours in the Walkenhorst Motorsport M6 GT3, completing the race in 22nd overall.

gb.subtitle: Making its appearance 25 years on from the first generation model, the new dimension in sports cars with SH-AWD.
gb.description: Making its official debut 25 years after the appearance of the original, the second generation NSX is a supercar featuring an electric four-wheel drive system called the 'Sports Hybrid' SH-AWD system, with independent left and right electric motors on the front wheels. With improvements not only in acceleration but also deceleration, the system enables torque vectoring which allows for stable cornering in all speed ranges.

gb.subtitle: This super fast Clio set the compact hatch record at the Nürburgring.
gb.description: The Clio R.S. 220 EDC Trophy is a sports version of the 4th generation Clio developed by Renault Sport. This version is known as the R.S. Vision and features a novel new bumper designed to evoke the image of a chequered flag. It also features new LED front and tail lights, and other new design innovations throughout.

gb.subtitle: The new generation BMW GT3 powered by a 4.4L Twin Turbo.
gb.description: The successor to the Z4 GT3 which had been BMW's mainstay GT3 race car since 2010. In contrast to the compact Z4, this car has a more opposing stature, measuring roughly 5 m long and over 2 m wide. The engine is a 4.4L V8 with twin turbos and produces 576.9 BHP on stock settings. The body is made mostly from carbon fibre and the frame and suspension have received a complete design overhaul, making this car considerably different from consumer model M6.

gb.subtitle: The Ultimate ‘Nürburgring Meister’ Toyota 86.
gb.description: Only available to order over the internet starting on January 2016, the 86 GRMN was a complete tuned car built by Toyota, based on their popular 86 sports car. In addition to structural reinforcements, the centre of gravity was lowered through the use of lightweight materials. The car features a number of other modifications; power output has been increased of course, but it also features a new close ratio 6-speed manual transmission as well as stronger brakes and different size tyres for the front and rear.

gb.subtitle: A machine for private racers, carrying on the bloodline of the GTS-R.
gb.description: At the debut of the 3rd generation Viper in 2012, it was also announced that there would be a racing model, the GTS-R. The GT3-R is a GT3 machine made for private teams, based on the GTS-R. Developed by SRT (Chrysler's high performance development team) and Riley Technologies, the weight of the car has been drastically reduced, and aerodynamic enhancements have been added. The car has already proved its racing potential in numerous GT races in America and other parts of the world.

gb.subtitle: Dominated the podium of the Nürburgring 24 Hour Race on its 1st year of participation.
gb.description: The AMG GT3 is Mercedes-Benz's GT3 race car. Debuting in 2016, it competed in GT3 category races around the world. Its incredible performance allowed it to take places 1-4 in its first outing at the Nürburgring 24 Hours. One of its most successful users is HTP Motorsport who are regularly competing for the top spots in the Blancpain GT Series.

gb.subtitle: A safety car spec Nissan GT-R made to patrol the circuit.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original turns Nissan's R35 GT-R supercar into a safety car. The roof-mounted LED patrol lights and light arrays on the front and rear bumper have greatly increased its visibility. The centre console also features extra switches exclusive to this model.

gb.subtitle: This stylish sports coupé has attracted numerous fans with its low nose and short overhang design.
gb.description: The LC500 is a luxury sports car that was unveiled at the 2016 Geneva Motor Show. While it has a flowing streamlined coupé body, the front and rear overhangs have been shortened to allow for a front midship layout with 2+2 seating. The body also uses a variety of materials to lighten the body while also providing ample rigidity.

gb.subtitle: The Lexus RC F GT3 that competed in the 2016 VLN.
gb.description: The RC F GT3 is a GT3 spec race car developed from the Lexus RC F. This prototype was produced before homologation in order to test performance. This car won the 9th round of the VLN (Nürburgring Endurance Series). At that time it competed with the bare carbon bodywork, but the version seen here features the Emil Frey Racing livery.

gb.subtitle: The 6th generation Mustang marks model’s 50th anniversary. Ford's tour de force is sold in 120 countries around the world.
gb.description: The Mustang Gr.B is a Gran Turismo Original model which takes Ford's legendary Mustang coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.B regulations. The livery is based on the Ford GT works livery. Ford has a deep history in rallying having produced cars like the Escort and RS200, so this seemingly mismatched custom actually fits the bill quite well.

3230.name: Lancer Evolution Final Gr.B Rally Car

gb.subtitle: The truly final model, bringing a close to their long history in the WRC.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of Mitsubishi's high performance sedan, the Lancer Evolution Final Edition, modified for Gr.B regulations. The white, silver and red design of this rally car is an homage to World Rally cars of the past. The Gr.3 style aero parts provide strong downforce giving this car potential to go up against even modern WRC cars.

gb.subtitle: A fully fledged sports coupé with sharp cornering ability.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Volkswagen's stylish Scirocco sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 standards. The aero parts are relatively understated with a small front splitter and rear wing, but this car aims to utilize the high performance present in the base model, with a cornering ability that exceeds most front-wheel drive cars.

gb.subtitle: A model stemming from the Impreza in pursuit of speed and the fun of driving.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Subaru's high performance WRX sedan has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. To increase downforce and manoeuvrability, the track width has been greatly increased and long stroke suspension has been installed for better off-road performance, which all results in a cutting edge rally machine.

gb.subtitle: A high-performance sports coupé with circuit-developed components.
gb.description: Hyundai's rear-wheel drive Genesis sports car has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Along with a four-wheel drive conversion, this car features a number of modern rally car trends. The front fenders feature organic curves maximising downforce, while the wide track at over 2,050 mm provides extra manoeuvrability to the body's long wheelbase.

gb.subtitle: Making its appearance 25 years on from the first generation model, the new dimension in sports cars with SH-AWD.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.3 regulations. The car features a number of parts to increase aerodynamic effect, like the large front splitter which features cutouts to smooth airflow, and the swan-neck rear wing.

gb.subtitle: An original racing version of Mazda's flagship Atenza model for Gr.3 competition.
gb.description: Mazda's Atenza global sedan has been modified for Gr.3 use in this Gran Turismo Original. The exterior features aggressive yet streamlined aerodynamics which follow Mazda's 'KODO' design philosophy. To increase body rigidity, a bulkhead has been added at the back of the cockpit, along with a rear view camera to increase visibility.

gb.subtitle: A Gr.3 race car version of the Peugeot RCZ compact coupé.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, this is a version of the RCZ, Peugeot's elegant flowing specialty car, modified for Gr.3 rules. In order to improve weight distribution and overall performance, the car drivetrain has been converted from a front-engine front-wheel drive system to a midship rear-wheel drive layout. With its long 2,612 mm wheelbase the RCZ is the perfect candidate for race car conversion.

gb.subtitle: This new generation SH-AWD sports car finally came to fruition 25 years after the debut of the original NSX.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. This car exhibits a rally-cross style exterior, but keeps the NSX's characteristic midship layout, simply converting it to four-wheel drive. The rear-heavy weight distribution remains unchanged, which should produce some exciting tail slides.

gb.subtitle: This Gr.B design reimagines the Nissan GT-R as a full on off-road racer.
gb.description: Nissan's 'multi-performance' R35 GT-R has been modified for Gr.B competition in this Gran Turismo Original. The most obvious exterior changes are the quad fog lamps on the bonnet and the large fog lamps on each side of the bumper for lighting up the track on night stages. The already superb four-wheel drive system gives the GT-R an edge in rallying as well.

gb.subtitle: An original Gr.B rally tuned version of the Peugeot RCZ compact coupé.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, this is a version of the RCZ, Peugeot's elegant flowing specialty car, modified for Gr.B rules. This model has been designed in the image of Pikes Peak cars, featuring an extra large front spoiler and rear wing. The engine has been moved to behind the cockpit and now uses a four-wheel drive powertrain.

gb.subtitle: This Gran Turismo original Gr.4 race car maximises the performance of the M4.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original takes BMW's new-generation high-performance M4 coupé and modifies it to meet Gr.4 regulations. A proven performer, it manages to retain the cornering ability and stability that BMW is known for despite its touring car style appearance. Its excellent drivability means that even new drivers should have no problem keeping it on track.

gb.subtitle: The incredible monster machine capable of exceeding 233 mph using a special key.
gb.description: Bugatti's Veyron supercar has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations for this Gran Turismo Original. Though the power output has been reduced from the base model for Gr.4 rules, it is still able to stand up to all rivals with its straight-line speed. It also has an advantage in the corners thanks to its four-wheel drive stability.

gb.subtitle: The 7th generation Corvette, worthy of the legendary 'Stingray' badge.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the C7, the final front-engine Corvette, to meet Gr.4 regulations. The predictable cornering characteristics of the base car make for a driver friendly experience. It also has superb straight line speed, so drivers should have no trouble keeping up with the competition anywhere on the track.

gb.subtitle: A concept car for the virtual world, developed in collaboration with Citroën.
gb.description: A racing car designed for competition in the Gr.4 category, it is a modified version of the 'GT by Citroën', which was unveiled at the 2008 Paris Motor Show. Modifications were performed by Takumi Yamamoto, who created the original design. The exterior features a 6-colour livery, as well as a large rear wing. In the meantime, the interior received modifications to the steering wheel and HUD.

gb.subtitle: The 3rd generation Viper, backed by extreme performance under the SRT brand.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original modifies the Viper, Dodge's high-performance sports car, to meet Gr.4 regulations. The exterior features an aggressive front splitter and canards, along with a large rear wing to produce an immense downforce. The result is a car that is great in the straights and has much potential for the corners as well.

gb.subtitle: A version of the SH-AWD 2nd generation NSX modified for Gr.4 competition.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Honda's flagship NSX sports car has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations. This design focuses on utilizing the characteristics of the base car, with only a small splitter and canards added along with the rear wing. In order to increase rigidity, a rear bulkhead has been added, along with a rear camera.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate model of the pure high performance sportscar and heir to the lineage of the famed E-type.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Jaguar's new-generation F-type coupé has been modified to meet Gr.4 rules. The car has been given a fierce new look with matte grey paint and the front grille garnishes removed. On the performance side however, it's actually quite manageable in the corners and has excellent straight-line speed.

gb.subtitle: Continuing the aesthetic style of the Gallardo, this 4WD supercar is lighter and more powerful.
gb.description: Lamborghini's entry-level, mid-ship four-wheel drive Huracán has been transformed into a Gr.4 regulation machine for this Gran Turismo Original. The high stability from the four-wheel drive layout, and the agile cornering ability of the mid-ship layout's weight distribution result in a well-balanced and well-behaved machine.

gb.subtitle: A version of the acclaimed Lexus RC F modified for Gr.4.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of the Lexus RC F high performance coupé, modified for Gr.4 competition. With the immense torque of the high displacement V8 engine, this car excels in straight line acceleration. The base colour is the same orange that Lexus uses on their special models.

gb.subtitle: An original racing version of Mazda's flagship Atenza model for Gr.4 competition.
gb.description: Mazda's Atenza global sedan has been modified for Gr.3 use in this Gran Turismo Original. Being based on a four-wheel drive system, this touring car has excellent traction. A Gr.3 style large front grille and bonnet vents have been added to help the 4-cylinder turbo engine produce its incredible 394.5 BHP.

gb.subtitle: A Gran Turismo original Gr.4 spec version of the McLaren 650S super sports car.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, this Gr.4 car is based on the 650S, McLaren's mid-level super car. Featuring McLaren's factory racing colour, this colourful machine offers predictable handling and stability to easily conquer any corner. The interior furnishings, fuel cap and jack up points are all GT3 level equipment.

gb.subtitle: This final model closes the curtain on a long and historic WRC career.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of Mitsubishi's high performance sedan, the Lancer Evolution Final Edition, modified for Gr.4 regulations. The Lancer had seen great success in real world touring car races, and this version should be no less successful as it uses the Lancer's proprietary electronically controlled four-wheel drive system to achieve impressive turning power.

gb.subtitle: A Gr.4 race car version of the Peugeot RCZ compact coupé.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, this is a version of the RCZ, Peugeot's elegant flowing specialty car, modified for Gr.4 rules. Set up as an orthodox front-wheel drive touring car, the RCZ Gr.4 adds a front splitter and rear wing, as well as new, more aerodynamic front fenders.

gb.subtitle: The limited edition car that set the lap record for mass-produced front-wheel drives on the Nürburgring.
gb.description: This Gran Turismo Original is a version of the Renault's fastest hatchback, the Mégane, modified for Gr.4 rules. The Mégane has already set an incredible time on the Nürburgring so it's only natural it has great potential as a race car. The superb traction and cornering ability will make you forget this is a front-wheel drive car.

gb.subtitle: A model stemming from the Impreza in pursuit of speed and the fun of driving.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Subaru's high performance WRX sedan has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations. A front splitter and rear wing have been added to increase downforce and improve cornering. The four-wheel drive system of the base car has been carried over giving it the best traction out of all the Gr.4 cars.

gb.subtitle: A Gran Turismo original version of the Toyota 86 FR sports car modified for Gr.4.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo original, this version of Toyota's new standard sports model, the '86', has been modified to meet Gr.4 regulations. Though the 86 has already competed in clubman races around the world, this version has been turned into a true race car, with its power output increased to 364 horsepower. This machine excels in the corners where it can use its light compact body to its full advantage.

gb.subtitle: Producing an astonishing 562.1 BHP, the V8 mid-engine car that takes its heritage from the F430.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, this is a Gr.4 version of the 458 Italia an entry-level model in Ferrari's line-up. The base model already produces ample downforce so while there are relatively few aero parts visible, the car is extremely stable. Along with the flexible Ferrari V8 and 7-speed transmission, this car has excellent potential on the circuit.

gb.subtitle: The chassis performance of the late 3rd generation model shines in this rally special.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo Original, Ford's Focus global hatchback has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. Air intakes have been added ahead of the rear fenders to send air to the rear mounted radiator. Moving the radiator to the boot has improved the weight distribution and resulted in one of the easiest cars to drive of the Gr.B category.

gb.subtitle: An off-road version of Toyota's FR sports car, the 86, modified for Gr.B competition.
gb.description: A Gran Turismo original, this version of Toyota's new standard sports model, the '86', has been modified to meet Gr.B regulations. The car has been transformed into a top class rally car with the rear-wheel drive of the base model converted to a four-wheel drive layout and the canards and 2-level rear wing producing a strong downforce.

gb.subtitle: BMW’s first commercial electric car provides sportscar level acceleration.
gb.description: An electric vehicle unveiled by BMW in 2013. The boxy, 4-door body features small pillarless rear doors and weighs just 1,195 kg thanks to the use of aluminium alloys for the chassis with carbon fibre for the cabin. The motor produces 167.7 BHP/25 kgfm, and from a standing start the car can reach 37.3 mph in 3.7 seconds and 62.1 mph in just 7.2 seconds. With a top speed of over 93.2 mph, this car can definitely stand up to its rivals powered by internal combustion engines.

gb.subtitle: The flagship model of Ferrari packing F1 Technology.
gb.description: The F12berlinetta is a flagship model from Ferrari introduced in 2012 to replace the 599 GTB Fiorano. It features a new aluminium space frame and body shell equipped with a front-midship mounted V12 engine. Performance increases from the optimized body layout allow for a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.1s and a top speed of 211.3 mph. It would set the lap record at the Fiorano test track.

gb.subtitle: The ultimate 991, rebuilt from the ground up.
gb.description: This high performance model is a further improved version of the 991 model Porsche 911 GT3. Starting with the wide body of the 911 Turbo, the front and rear track width has been increased, alongside major weigh reductions and aerodynamic improvements. Now enlarged to 4L, the engine produces 493.1 BHP and was able to set a lap time of 7m20s on the Nürburgring Nordschleife.

gb.subtitle: Low centre of gravity and excellent front-to-rear weight distribution. A true FR sports car developed in collaboration with Subaru.
gb.description: Released in 2012, the Toyota 86 is a sports car which combines a compact body with a rear-wheel drive layout. The first minor update in 2016 would improve body rigidity and aerodynamics. 6-speed manual models would also receive an engine tune and improvements for many other parts, emphasising performance over appearance. This 'GT Limited' model is the highest grade in the 86 lineup. The interior features high-quality materials like leather and Alcantara for an overall more mature appearance.

gb.subtitle: The 7th generation Corvette, worthy of the legendary 'Stingray' badge.
gb.description: A homologation model of the C7 Gr.3, a version of the C7, the final front-engine Corvette modified for Gr.3 standards. This car is notable for its striking exterior which fully utilizes the 2,050 mm width restrictions of Gr.3. Looking towards its performance, the large body betrays its true nature as a cornering machine, able to make quick, nimble movements thanks to its race car style suspension.

gb.subtitle: This celebrated WRX set the lap record at the holy ground of motorcycle racing, the Isle of Man.
gb.description: In June 2016, a Subaru WRX STI set a new record for 4-wheeled cars in a time attack at the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy race. The WRX STI had been competing in this event since 2011, but the 2016 machine was constructed by Prodrive of Britain, who had won numerous World Rally Championship titles. As a result, they were able to shave the record down by almost 2 minutes to 17:35.139, achieving an average speed of 128.6 mph.

gb.subtitle: These TTs were specially produced for the 'Audi Sport TT Cup' one-make race.
gb.description: A racing car based on the Audi TT produced for the 'Audi Sport TT Cup' one-make race.
