gb.subtitle: A 4th consecutive winner at Le Mans for Toyota, this prototype race car took centre stage at the beginning of the hypercar era.
gb.description: The TOYOTA GR010 HYBRID 2021 is a successor to the TS050, developed to meet new regulations introduced in 2021. The engine has been changed to a 3.5L V6 twin-turbo unit (670.6 BHP) in a four-wheel drive layout with a 268.2 BHP electric motor located in the front of the vehicle. Driver teams which included Kamui Kobayashi and Kazuki Nakajima would go on to win all 6 rounds of the WEC season including Le Mans, marking the start of the hypercar era.

gb.subtitle: A Genesis sports sedan in which all four wheels were powered by a V6 twin turbo engine.
gb.description: Genesis' G70 sports sedan was introduced in 2017 as the brand's entry model. 3 power unit options were available, a 3.3L V6 twin-turbo, a 2L petrol turbo and a 2.2L turbodiesel, with the V6 producing 364.9 BHP. A major facelift was released in 2020, adopting design features from the luxury models. The car also gained attention when a shooting brake model was released exclusively for Europe in 2021.

gb.subtitle: A Genesis sports sedan in which all four wheels were powered by a V6 twin turbo engine.
gb.description: As an entry model, the G70 is tasked with introducing drivers to the appeal of the Genesis brand. The design was updated in 2020, adopting the aesthetics of the higher grade models, and in 2021 a shooting brake was introduced exclusively for Europe. This Genesis G70 GR4 is a Gran Turismo version tuned for Gr.4 competition.

gb.subtitle: A Gr.3 machine that combines luxury with competition performance.
gb.description: In April 2021, Genesis unveiled their vision for new future GT cars, the Genesis X Concept. It uses the company's 'Athletic Elegance' design language, featuring the crest grille and straight body lines. The Genesis X GR3 is a racing machine that inherits the essence of this design. This innovative Gr.3 machine realises the merging of luxury and competition prowess.

gb.subtitle: The 7th generation model Z-car is a 21st century reinterpretation of the classic S30.
gb.description: This production model of the 7th generation Fairlady Z first appeared as a prototype in 2020. Nissan chose not to use an electric drivetrain, instead utilising a VR30DDTT 3L V6 twin-turbo engine connected to either a 6-speed manual transmission or 9-speed automatic with manual shift mode. While the automotive industry as a whole looks towards revolutions in self-driving and electrification, this car chases the romanticism of a front engine, rear-wheel drive sports car.

gb.subtitle: The 2nd gen. compact FR sports car features a larger 2.4L engine.
gb.description: The Toyota 86 and Subaru BRZ boxer engine, rear-wheel drive sports cars were developed in a tag-team effort between Toyota and Subaru. The series would evolve to the 2nd generation ZD8 model in 2020. The new body was lighter yet more rigid, while the engine was a newly developed boxer unit with a larger displacement at 2.4L. Its maximum output is 231.8 BHP. The Subaru BRZ 'S' grade featured here is a high-end model with upgraded interior and exterior fittings.

gb.subtitle: Porsche's modern yet daring statement on the future of the sports car.
gb.description: A Spyder version of the Porsche Vision Gran Turismo, itself unveiled in 2021. The exterior and interior seamlessly blend together to create the most immersive driving experience possible. The power unit uses dual electric motors, while the novel active aero system adapts to provide the optimum aerodynamics for the conditions at hand.

gb.subtitle: This Gr.3 Vision Gran Turismo is full of Suzuki's fighting spirit.
gb.description: The SUZUKI Vision Gran Turismo utilises the latest engine from the 'Hayabusa' sports bike, along with the latest electrification and weight reduction technologies. The powertrain uses the 1,340 cm³ engine of the Hayabusa along with 3 high-power electric motors in an all-wheel drive configuration. The engine and motors combined provide a total output of 426 BHP at 9,700 rpm, making this a compact super sports machine.

gb.subtitle: A first in Porsche 911 history, the elusive Rennsport.
gb.description: The first model in the history of the Porsche 911 to bear the 'RS' badge was the 911 Carrera RS 2.7, released in 1973. RS stands for 'Rennsport' or literally 'racing sport' in English. This car was developed for homologation in the FIA's Group 4 category. It proved to be very popular, with its original planned run of 500 units selling out instantly. Porsche subsequently increased production numbers and in total 1,580 of these cars were produced.

gb.subtitle: A single-seater concept that pushes the boundaries of the hypercar genre.
gb.description: The Ferrari Vision Gran Turismo is Ferrari's first ever virtual-only single seater concept and features design inspirations from sports prototype cars of the 1960s and 70s. The 3L turbo charged V6 hybrid engine combined with the 3 electric motors produced a total system output of 1,015.8 BHP. The design carries on the DNA of past classics while giving a powerful hint of the future of endurance racing.

gb.subtitle: The prototype EV that rewrote speed records around the world.
gb.description: Volkswagen's prototype race car is a role model for carbon reduction. The carbon fibre body features large wings at the front and rear of the car, and is equipped with 2 electric motors driving the front and rear axles. It also boasts stunning performance, setting incredible times on Pikes Peak, the Nürburgring Nordschleife, and Goodwood.

gb.subtitle: This motorsports base model epitomizes the core concepts of the Roadster.
gb.description: A motorsports base car introduced to the 4th generation Roadster lineup. The drivetrain has been upgraded to circuit driving specs, along with adding a larger radiator and disc brakes. The suspension features height-adjustable dampers from Bilstein. Further upgrades were implemented in 2022, adding Kinematic Posture Control to greatly increase rear stability.

gb.subtitle: The 6th gen. Silvia presents heightened luxury in a wide body format.
gb.description: The wider body of the S14 model Silvia provided an extra feeling of luxury. The engine is a returned version of the SR20 from the S13 and is further equipped with an intercooled turbocharger on the top grade K's model. The basic suspension setup has also been carried over from the S13 with struts on the front and a multilink setup on the rear. A model with electric Super HICAS was also available.

gb.subtitle: A historic vision of the future from France.
gb.description: The Citroën DS was unveiled at the 1955 Paris Salon as a revolutionary front-wheel drive car featuring an aerodynamic body and hydropneumatic suspension. It was dubbed the 'flying saucer'. Development was lead by André Lefèbvre, and the body designed by Flaminio Bertoni. In 1964, the 'Pallas' grade was introduced, and in 1967 came the quad headlights. The DS 21 Pallas offered elegant performance from its 2.1L engine and was produced for 20 years.

gb.subtitle: The new generation midship Corvette.
gb.description: Released in 2019, the eighth generation Corvette became the very first in the line to use a midship layout, a major change to the powertrain. The new 6.2L V8 'LT2' produced 495.1 BHP/65.0 kgfm and was attached to an 8-speed dual clutch transmission. While it lost the iconic long nose, it performed incredibly in its main category of GT racing with its modern performance characteristics.

gb.subtitle: A four wheel drive road car that shines bright in automotive history.
gb.description: The Porsche 959 is a production version of the 'Gruppe B' prototype, itself developed by Porsche for competition in Group B, the top category of the WRC at the time. It features an advanced, electronically controlled four-wheel drive system that allows the driver to select the drivetrain mode to fit conditions, achieving not only excellent stability, but comfort as well. The disbanding of Group B meant it was never able to compete in the WRC, but it managed to achieve admirable results in other fields of racing.

gb.subtitle: Boasting 394.5 BHP and an extremely limited production run, the ultimate R33 GT-R from NISMO.
gb.description: In an era where Japanese passenger cars were typically limited to 276.1 BHP, NISMO introduced this complete tuned car which produced a maximum 394.5 BHP. It uses an enlarged 2.8L version of the classic RB26 engine known as the RB-X GT2 fitted with an N1 spec turbine. The suspension features Bilstein dampers along with upgraded stabilizers and bushings. The fenders have been stretched out to house the wider tyres, giving a hint at this car's incredible performance.

gb.subtitle: An elegant fastback with a revolutionary combustion system.
gb.description: The 4th generation MAZDA3 was introduced in 2018. The later introduced mild hybrid 'M Hybrid' model gained worldwide attention with its 'SKYACTIV-X' engine that used spark-controlled compression ignition. This 'X Burgundy Selection' is a limited edition model based on the X grade, which features the SKYACTIV-X, and a burgundy coloured interior that exudes a mature elegance.

gb.subtitle: A marvellous hot rod with 1,200BHP tucked into a nostalgic body.
gb.description: This 2018 SEMA 'Best of Show' winning 1971 Ford Maverick was created by the Greening Auto Company. The ride height has been dropped as far as possible for an eye-catching look. The 7L Windsor V8 engine has been fitted with 2 turbochargers to produce 1,199.2 BHP, but some flexibility has also been added and the engine control logic can be changed for a leisurely cruise around town.

gb.subtitle: A DTM machine with 2 victories in the Class 1 era.
gb.description: A 2019 Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters (DTM) car. Following engine downsizing rules introduced in Class 1, the engine has been changed from a 4L V8 to a 2L inline-4 turbo unit. This actually produced more power than the previous engine, and also offered benefits in weight and weight distribution. In the 2019 season, ace driver René Rast claimed the championship title along with the team title.

gb.subtitle: A homologation model with 500 cars produced for Group A racing.
gb.description: This homologation model of the R32 model Skyline GT-R was sold in a limited run of 500 units. Looking to claim victory in Group A, cooling improvements were implemented across the board, the turbocharger turbine was switched for a metal part, and the body was modified to improve aerodynamics and reduce weight. The performance increase was significant, and the car would win numerous touring car races, not only in Japan, but across Europe and Australia as well.

gb.subtitle: The F1 machine that garnered Honda their first victory.
gb.description: In 1965, this legendary machine earned Honda their first F1 victory. This car reuses the basic frame of the RA271, Honda's first F1 car, but has increased performance through the implementation of weight reduction across its component parts, moving to outboard rear suspension, and tuning the 'clockwork-like' 1.5L V12 engine. Though it suffered from stability issues at the start of the season, major improvements were made midway through, and it would eventually claim a well-earned victory in round 10 at the Mexican Grand Prix.

gb.subtitle: A time attack Civic customized in the classic JDM style.
gb.description: Winner of the 2017 'Gran Turismo Award'. The base 1992 EG model Civic has been fitted with a PANDEM wide body kit and carbon fibre bonnet based on a design by J's Racing. The interior has been stripped out, and the engine has been swapped for a K24 inline-4 unit. This car is a shining example of the JDM (Japanese Domestic Market) scene.

gb.subtitle: The next evolution of Super Formula cars aims to bring sustainability to motorsports.
gb.description: The Dallara SF23 Super Formula debuted in the spring of 2023 as the new car for the Super Formula series. As per the 'SUPER FORMULA NEXT50' project goal of making motorsports sustainable, the car uses bio-composite materials and CO2 emissions have been greatly reduced. Engines are supplied by Toyota and Honda.

gb.subtitle: The next evolution of Super Formula cars aims to bring sustainability to motorsports.
gb.description: The Dallara SF23 Super Formula debuted in the spring of 2023 as the new car for the Super Formula series. As per the 'SUPER FORMULA NEXT50' project goal of making motorsports sustainable, the car uses bio-composite materials and CO2 emissions have been greatly reduced. Engines are supplied by Toyota and Honda.

gb.subtitle: An iconic high performance coupe of Alfa Romeo in the 1960's.
gb.description: Introduced in 1962, the Alfa Romeo's first Giulia series started as a 4-door sedan, with the Sprint GT coupé model later added in 1963. Designed by Giugiaro, the body features smooth lines and gently curved surfaces. The Sprint GT became popular as a high performance sports coupé and remained in production until 1977.

gb.subtitle: An improved and more cost effective GT3 machine.
gb.description: This FIA homologated GT3 racing car is based on the AMG GT. While performance and aerodynamic improvements have been made, another focus of the development was the running costs of client teams. This led to longer engine life and better radiator protection among other additions. In 2020, the EVO model was introduced alongside a facelift for the road car with other new features.

gb.subtitle: A uniquely shaped hypercar with F1 derived aerodynamics.
gb.description: The Valkyrie hypercar was jointly developed by Red Bull Racing and Aston Martin. The front wing is suspended under the high nosed front section, while the whole underbody acts as a tunnel to produce tremendous downforce. The car is equipped with a 6.5L naturally aspirated V12 engine with KERS (kinetic energy recovery system) in a hybrid configuration. With a total system output of 1,139 BHP, the Valkyrie is close to top category racing machines in performance.

gb.subtitle: A masterpiece supercar carrying the determination and the passion of Maserati.
gb.description: This is Maserati's first mid-ship sports car in 15 years since the MC12. The streamlined body is designed by Dallara to produce a strong downforce without relying on external aero parts. The carbon monocoque weighs just 100 kg by itself and is equipped with the newly developed 3L V6 twin-turbo engine featuring F1 style pre-chambers.

gb.subtitle: Saving lives faster and more safely.
gb.description: From the 1950s, Toyota has produced ambulances made from specially outfitted passenger and commercial vehicles. The latest of these is the third-generation 'Himedic' high-standard ambulance introduced in 2006. The body is based on the 200 Series HiAce Super Long. With additions over the previous model such as the implementation of a larger patient area, this car has been designed with the utmost functionality in a lifesaving situation.

gb.subtitle: A 2-seater model that takes the GR Corolla to the extreme.
gb.description: The GR Corolla is a hot hatch created by Toyota's 'GR' high performance brand to topple its rivals in performance. While this is already the most powerful car in Corolla history, an even more extreme 'MORIZO Edition' was produced. While the automotive world looks towards electrification and intelligent systems, the GR Corolla is a rare example of the simple charms of the internal combustion engine.

gb.subtitle: Driving feel comes first. The legendary R badge returns for the 11th gen. Civic.
gb.description: The 6th generation model in the history of the Honda Civic Type R was released in September 2022. The car is based on the 'FL' 5-door hatchback model of the 11th generation Civic, which had already made its debut. The power unit is a 2L inline-4 turbo 'K20C' engine, producing both more power and torque than the 5th gen Type R at 325.4 BHP, 42.8 kgfm. The control parameters of the 4-wheel, independent active damper system have also been adjusted, providing better chassis performance.

gb.subtitle: Exploring the potential of internal combustion, a next-generation bio-diesel powered race car.
gb.description: This GT Original car takes inspiration from the 'MAZDA3 Bio concept' that competed in the ST-Q class of Japan's Super Endurance series. This car uses next generation 100% biodiesel fuel derived from waste cooking oils. The body also features environmentally conscious hybrid materials. This ambitious project aims to blend carbon neutrality in motorsports with top performance as a race car.

gb.subtitle: A true 60s muscle car, the envy of collectors everywhere.
gb.description: Introduced in 1966, the Dodge Charger was Chrysler's answer to the muscle car boom that swept the United States in the 1960s. The car proved popular for its relaxed stylings and its use of powerful large displacement V8 engines across all model grades. The 1968 model saw the introduction of the high performance 'R/T' (Road/Track), which featured upgraded suspension and brakes along with the option for a 426 Hemi engine.

gb.subtitle: A hyper performance street car packed with racing car features.
gb.description: The Porsche 911 GT3 RS (992) is a high-performance street car that features aero parts from the 911 GT3 R race car. The car is equipped with a number of highly advanced aerodynamics systems, such as a large, swan-neck rear wing equipped with DRS (drag reduction system), and an adjustable active diffuser which acts as an air brake on hard braking.

gb.subtitle: The bestseller from the company that changed the EV market forever.
gb.description: The Tesla Model 3 is a compact battery EV sedan. The most powerful model in the lineup is the Performance Dual Motor AWD grade, which is capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.3s and a top speed of 162.2 mph. Under WLTP testing, international standard for electrical and fuel efficiency, the car boasts a maximum range of 339.9 miles. In 2023, it would receive its first major update, featuring changes to the front mask, length and controls.

gb.subtitle: A digital concept car infused with the DNA of BVLGARI.
gb.description: The BVLGARI Aluminium Vision Gran Turismo was inspired by the 'BVLGARI Aluminium' which revolutionised the wristwatch world in 1998, sharing the same spirit: sporty, smart and essential, yet precise. The timeless and unique design expresses innovative conceptual spirit and style, while fully realising the BVLGARI design DNA, transcending short-term trends and fashions.

gb.subtitle: A single-seater all-wheel drive EV from the distinguished Czech manufacturer.
gb.description: A Czech manufacturer with 130 years of history behind it, Škoda's Gran Turismo debut model is an 800kW (1,071 BHP) single seater EV. The exterior features motifs from its forebearer classics alongside a wealth of cutting edge technologies such as the left-right independent active rear wings that adapt to driving conditions, and onboard distance sensors that judge the position of other cars.

3543.name: Genesis X Gran Berlinetta VGT Concept

gb.subtitle: A sports coupe that embodies the athletic elegance sought out by Genesis.
gb.description: The Genesis X Gran Berlinetta Vision Gran Turismo Concept is the ultimate rendering of Genesis' 'Athletic Elegance.' The design uses Genesis' trademark anti-wedge shape and exhibits new ideas for Genesis sports models. The powertrain combines the Lambda II V6 engine with electric assists to produce 1,071 HP (1,071 BHP.) The result is a car that matches its beauty with its power.

3544.name: Genesis X Gran Racer VGT Concept

gb.subtitle: The racing version of the Gran Berlinetta adorned with aerodynamic parts.
gb.description: The Genesis X Gran Racer Vision Gran Turismo Concept is the ultimate rendering of Genesis' 'Athletic Elegance.' The Racer version greatly increases downforce to improve lap times. The powertrain is a hybrid system with a V6 engine and electric assists, producing a total 1,518.7 BHP in power and 1,015ft-lb (140.3 kgfm) in torque.

gb.subtitle: Amazing all-terrain ability beyond its size. Japan's mighty micro off-roader.
gb.description: Japan's micro off-roader. Since its initial introduction in the 1970s, the Jimny has always used a kei regulation ladder frame construction with four-wheel drive rigid axle suspension and large diameter tyres. 2018 saw the release of the square bodied 4th generation model which has found use not only a leisure vehicle, but as a working car in mountainous regions as well.

gb.subtitle: A revolutionary 'mobility device' set to change how we spend time moving.
gb.description: The AFEELA Prototype 2024 is a BEV unveiled by Sony Honda Mobility at CES® 2024. Numerous sensing devices provide natural driver assistance, while on the interior, displays on the dashboard and seat backs provide copious amounts of entertainment. The AFEELA transforms travelling from waiting into time well spent.

gb.subtitle: The world's first hatchback found great success through utilitarian design.
gb.description: The Renault 4 ('Quatre') was introduced in 1961 to replace Renault's bestselling 4CV. This grandfather of the modern hatchback reached its full potential in 1978 with the GTL. This model added a plastic front grille and a powerful 1.1L engine, along with a modern instrument panel. The Renault 4 would gain an enormous following, and roughly 8,135,000 units were produced up until 1992. A car for the people, this is one of the greats of French automotive design.

gb.subtitle: Lamborghini's answer to the global SUV boom.
gb.description: Introduced in 2018, the Urus is Lamborghini's super SUV. It features the first use of forced induction in Lamborghini history, equipped with a 4L V8 twin-turbo engine capable of a 0-62.1 mph time of 3.6s and a top speed of 189.5 mph which was record breaking at its debut. With its active air suspension, rear wheel steering and torque vectoring systems, it was also capable of superior handling and cornering performance.

gb.subtitle: A historic model which taught the world to love the estate car.
gb.description: The 240 Estate was the car that cemented the image of Volvo as a station wagon manufacturer. The greatest appeal of the car is its square angles and elongated proportions. Other points include its simple, uniquely Scandinavian interior and its soft sofa style seats. Though many years have passed since the end of its production, this car still is still cherished by many as an everyday car, something that is quite rare among classics.

gb.subtitle: Subaru's triple race winning Impreza World Rally car from the 1998 season.
gb.description: This WRC machine is based on the 2-door Impreza. Starting from the 1997 model, this evolution adds computer controlled active differentials in the front, rear and centre. While it was unable to secure Subaru a 4th consecutive constructors title, driver Colin McRae claimed victory in the Portugal, Tour de Corse and Acropolis rallies, proving that it had the potential.

gb.subtitle: From race car to luxury grand tourer, the 3.2L second generation M3.
gb.description: The second M3 model was based on the E36 model 3 Series. While the original bore the trademarks of a competition car, this model was styled as grand tourer. Along with the addition of a straight six engine, a number of body styles were available including a 2-door, 4-door and cabriolet model. Originally a 3L engine, the 1995 model increased this to 3.2L, and introduced a 6-speed manual transmission alongside a 2-pedal SMG option.

gb.subtitle: This pinnacle of the R35 GT-R legacy debunked rumours of an end to production.
gb.description: The introduction of the 2024 model GT-R quashed rumours that production had ended with the 2022 model. A new exhaust silencer setup allowed the car to preserve its performance while clearing noise regulations. The exterior was also improved, increasing downforce. Additionally, the introduction of high sensitivity G-sensors in the electronically controlled suspension not only improved traction, but ride comfort as well.

gb.subtitle: The cab-over commercial van equally capable of moving people and cargo.
gb.description: The Hiace is the representative model of Toyota's commercial vehicles, finding support all over the world. Introduced in 2004 and constantly updated since, the 5th generation H200 model has become a record-setting long seller. The H200 is available in a number of grades according to body size, and is available with either a 2L or 2.7L petrol engine, or a 2.8L diesel engine. The Van DX is the standard roof height model with 2-wheel, rear-wheel drive. It is able of seating a maximum of 9 people, or the seats can be folded down to create a large cargo space.

gb.subtitle: A WRC homologation special with a unique double-decker wing design.
gb.description: Introduced in 1992, the Escort RS Cosworth is a homologation model supporting Ford's efforts in the WRC. Inheriting the 2L twin-cam engine (223.9 BHP) from the Sierra and equipped with a four-wheel drive system, it was capable of incredible performance in rallying. It achieved a 1-2 in the Rally de Portugal and consecutive wins in the Tour de Corse and Acropolis Rally, reinstating Ford's status as a rallying powerhouse.

gb.subtitle: The byword for multipurpose high mobility vehicles.
gb.description: The Unimog is a commercial vehicle constructed and sold by Daimler Truck. First produced in 1948, it would prove to be a long-seller as a multi-purpose vehicle. The 411 series is a successor model introduced in 1956, featuring a more powerful engine and stronger body. Between the 3 wheelbase options and multiple body types, there are 12 different models in the lineup, which can be further modified with a variety of attachments.

gb.subtitle: A legendary F1 car that made motorsports history.
gb.description: The W 196 was developed by Mercedes-Benz looking towards F1 regulations which were moving to 2.5L from 1954. The W 196 R was constructed for use in F1. The 2,496 cc inline-8 engine produces 285 BHP and is able to reach a top speed of 180.2 mph. It would achieve incredible results in the 1954 and 1955 F1 World Championship, with driver Juan Manuel Fangio taking the drivers' title 2 years running.

gb.subtitle: The top performance model of the 8th generation 911.
gb.description: Having served as the icon of the Porsche brand since the 1960s, the 911 would reach its 8th generation in 2018 with the type 992 model. In April 2020, the Turbo S was added to the 992 family as the top performance model. The twin-turbo 3,745 cc flat-6 engine produces 641 BHP/81.6 kgfm and pushes this explosive power through all 4 wheels for a 0-62.1 mph time of 2.7s and a top speed of 205.1 mph.

gb.subtitle: A 'chunkier' Jimny with an eye on global success.
gb.description: This 3-door model of the Jimny has been lengthened and widened to fit the international market. The part-time four-wheel drive system with mechanical transfer case is now mated to a 1,460 cc inline-4 DOHC engine, achieving unwavering off-road ability. This 3rd generation JB74 model, counting from the original Sierra, was met with critical acclaim for its square, stretched out styling.

gb.subtitle: A concept hypercar to celebrate Porsche's 75th anniversary.
gb.description: This all-electric hypercar was unveiled on 8 June 2023, exactly 75 years after the approval of the Porsche's first car, the 356 'No.1' Roadster. The exterior features motifs from the company's long history of race cars, and a highly sports driving focused cockpit. The car achieves a power-to-weight ratio of 1 horsepower per 1 kg and produces significantly more downforce than the 992 model 911 GT3 RS.

gb.subtitle: A fearsome driving machine that challenges the preconceptions of BEVs.
gb.description: This performance model was introduced 2 years after the original release of the IONIQ 5. The four-wheel drive system uses electric motors on the front and rear axles allowing for freely adjustable torque distribution. When set to a rear bias, this allows for the over 2-ton body to be drifted. This unusual electric SUV also attempts to retain the excitement of a conventional engine car, offering a simulated 8-speed DCT and exhaust noises.

gb.subtitle: An original formula car created in the image of classic F1 cars.
gb.description: The F3500-A is a Gran Turismo original formula machine born from a deep admiration for early 1990s F1 cars. It features a carbon fibre chassis and pushrod suspension. The 3.5L naturally aspirated V12 engine is able to reach 15,000 rpm and is connected to a 6-speed semiautomatic transmission. Formula cars are constantly evolving. The F3500-A can be considered a benchmark to see how far they have come.

gb.subtitle: A dominating force on the touring car circuit, this 4th generation Civic features the famous ZC engine.
gb.description: In 1987, the Honda Civic received a full model change, introducing the 4th generation. Known as the Grand Civic, the model code is EF. Its most notable feature is the platform change, which introduces double wishbone suspension on all 4 wheels. The 'Si' sport model and luxury 'Si Extra' model both use the 1.6L inline-4 DOHC 'ZC' engine. The Si and Si Extra also competed in the Japan Touring Car Championship, where they would claim title victories.

gb.subtitle: A masterpiece hot hatch from France that became a rally legend.
gb.description: The 205 GTI was released as a sports model in the image of Peugeot's '205 Turbo 16' World Rally Championship car. The lightweight, compact body was equipped with a lively 1.6L SOHC engine, resulting in all-around excellent performance. This masterpiece of French automotive engineering would sell over 300,000 units in Europe alone, making it an absolutely essential part of 1980s-90s car history.

gb.subtitle: The unconventional crossover SUV that took on the Nürburgring 24 Hours.
gb.description: Following a number of internationally-oriented models like the Corolla and Yaris, in 2016, Toyota introduced the C-HR crossover SUV which was developed as a new global car for the 21st century. This unconventional SUV also displayed aspirations as a sports car with a prototype model appearing in the Nürburgring 24 Hours. The body uses the new-generation TNGA platform, equipped with either a 1.8L hybrid unit, or a 1.2L inline-4 turbo engine. The C-HR would find widespread support, becoming a bestseller.

gb.subtitle: A crossover SUV from Mazda featuring a revolutionary engine design.
gb.description: The CX-30 is a crossover SUV introduced to fill the gap between the CX-3 and CX-5. While relatively compact, it exhibits the flowing 'KODO Design' apparent in its front mask and the reflections of light across its body. The CX-30 X Smart Edition was introduced in 2021. This version features the SKYACTIV-X engine along with many driver assists and an improved pedal feel.

gb.subtitle: A popular leisure activity vehicle that began its life as a commercial van.
gb.description: In French, small vans are known as 'fourgonette'. The Kangoo gained mass support thanks to its sliding passenger doors and split back seats, which made it perfect for not just commercial, but personal leisure use as well. It would become the forerunner of 'ludospace'—leisure activity vehicles. Though the engine offers the bare minimum in power, the soft suspension makes for a lively driving experience.

gb.subtitle: Nissan's compact SUV is even better with e-Power.
gb.description: The Qashqai is a compact SUV which debuted in 2006 and occupies the C-segment of Nissan’s lineup. The third generation model featured a larger body with an overhauled exterior design. This car is available with Nissan’s proprietary ‘e-Power’ series hybrid drivetrain, which uses a conventional engine to turn an electric generator which provides power to the electric motors which drive the wheels. The ‘Tekna’ grade model includes a wealth of equipment as standard, including larger wheel rims, ambient lights and a head-up display.

gb.subtitle: The second wave GT-R finishes with the ultimate complete tuned car.
gb.description: The NISMO R34 GT-R Z-tune is a comprehensively tuned complete custom package. Based on the R34 model Skyline GT-R, the engine has swapped for a 2.8L version of the RB26DETT Kai-Z2 used in GT500 class racing. Body rigidity has been improved through extra spot welds and additional carbon fibre parts, alongside fine adjustments to suspension and brakes, which all speaks to NISMO’s commitment to tuning. Including the original prototype, only 19 of these cars were ever produced.

gb.subtitle: The peak of the 5th gen Corvette line-up revives the classic Z06 moniker.
gb.description: The hardtop model added to the Corvette C5 line-up in 1999 utilized the increased body rigidity to improve performance. What's more is the coupé model was priced lower than the standard model, leading to widespread support from enthusiasts. Performance was increased even further in 2001, this evolved Z06 model invoked the image of the C2 and boasted the fastest top speed for a production car.

gb.subtitle: A quintessential example of the 'micro-truck' trend that's sweeping the globe.
gb.description: Japan's micro-car segment, known domestically as kei cars, has become an essential part of daily life across the country. The Suzuki Carry compact truck is a quintessential example of the subcategory of commercial kei cars which features a wide variety of cargo vans and trucks. The Carry has a long history, being originally introduced in 1961. The version featured here is the 2012 model, the final iteration of the 10th generation. Thanks to its charming looks and practicality, the Carry has recently also found an audience overseas.

gb.subtitle: The 5th generation model of this popular SUV is the first to feature a hybrid system.
gb.description: In the 1990s, Honda created the 'Creative Mover' category, releasing the original CR-V in 1995. This 2021 model of the 5th generation CR-V is the first to feature a hybrid power unit. The four-wheel drive option was also popular. The larger body has improved habitability, increased cargo space to over 1,100L. A 3-row 7-seater model is now available too. Thanks to its wealth of safety equipment and driver assists, it's the perfect car for everyday driving.

gb.subtitle: Citroën's do-it-all tourer features a modern new look.
gb.description: The BX debuted at the 1982 Paris Salon. It carries the image of Citroën's historic GS and CX models while presenting a modern geometric design. It was designed by Marcello Gandini while he was working for Bertone. The suspension uses Citroën's classic hydropneumatic system. The 19 TRS model featured here is a grand tourer style model featuring a 1.9L petrol engine.

gb.subtitle: This compact SUV displays Peugeot design touches throughout.
gb.description: The Peugeot 2008 was introduced in 2013. This featured 2008 SUV is a second generation model. It uses the same platform as Peugeot's '208' hatchback model. The lights feature motifs of a lion's claws and fangs. Another notable feature of this compact SUV is the '3D i-Cockpit' which consists of a small diameter steering wheel with a flattened top and bottom, and a head-up digital instrument panel centred above it.

gb.subtitle: A jewel of a compact car which designer Giugiaro called his greatest work.
gb.description: The FIAT Panda is a front-wheel drive hatchback that debuted in 1980 during the compact car boom that followed the oil crises. Its packaging was designed by virtuoso Giorgetto Giugiaro. In order to reduce costs, the body is constructed with straight lines and flat panels, giving it a simple yet modern and practical appearance. When it was first released, the car was available with either an air-cooled 652 cc 2-cylinder engine or a water cooled 903 cc 4-cylinder engine. This model featured in Gran Turismo is the former.

gb.subtitle: This 'hot' model boasts the first front-wheel drive turbo, 6-speed manual transmission combo in a kei car.
gb.description: The N-ONE is a kei car that takes cues from Honda’s very first kei regulation model, the N360. The second generation N-ONE carries over the body panels from the original model while using a new chassis. The 2nd gen lineup also features the ‘RS’ sport model which uses the same close-ratio gears as the S660 sports car, with heavy duty synchronizers on second and third gear, along with a heavy duty clutch. The RS grade was also available on the original model, but the 2nd gen RS is notable for being the first kei car to combine a turbocharged front-wheel drive layout with a 6-speed manual transmission.

gb.subtitle: A Vision Gran Turismo embodying the electric spirit of Opel’s GSE sports car brand.
gb.description: The Opel Corsa GSE Vision Gran Turismo is a fully electric high-performance concept car that combines Opel’s respect for tradition with its passion for futuristic technology. Two electric motors, one on each axle, provide a total system output of 588 kW (788 BHP). This allows the car to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 2 seconds, and ultimately reach a top speed of 198.8 mph. It also features excellent aerodynamic performance, with features like an active aero diffusor and spoiler that ensure stability at high speeds.

gb.subtitle: With only 200 units ever produced, this is the ultimate works-tuned roadster.
gb.description: This car was created by MAZDA SPIRIT RACING, an initiative started in 2021 to represent Mazda's motorsports activities. Though based on the ND Roadster, it features a 2L block that was not normally available on Japanese soft-tops, with specially designed camshafts, cylinder head, pistons, and exhaust manifold. This results in a power of 197.2 BHP, somewhere near the limit of what is practical in a production model. Other adjustments have been made across the entirety of the chassis that draw on the company's deep well of knowledge gained from Super Endurance racing.

gb.subtitle: A new ‘mobility’ to challenge the concept of transportation.
gb.description: The AFEELA 1 was unveiled at CES® 2025. This production model is available in 2 trim levels, Origin and Signature. Featuring a luxurious interior styled as a Creative Entertainment Space, this BEV challenges previous concepts of travel. It features a wealth of advanced technologies such as sensing devices embedded in the exterior and a personal agent that is able to converse in natural speech.

gb.subtitle: An electric hypercar that offers a glimpse into the future of the Corvette.
gb.description: The Corvette CX Concept is an all-wheel drive electric hypercar. The fan-powered downforce system balances downforce across the front and rear of the car through fighter jet style thrust vector control. This allows for effective control of the over 2000 horsepower produced by its 4 electric motors. Designed to feel at home on the roads as on the track, this car is a vision of the future of American sports cars.

gb.subtitle: A futuristic GT racer born from the Corvette lineage.\t
gb.description: The Corvette CX.R Vision Gran Turismo Concept is a track-only model based on the Corvette CX Concept. This car has superior aerodynamics to the base CX Concept, with a much lower ride height. It is powered by a hybrid system that combines e-fuels with electric power, securing the high performance and range required for endurance racing.

gb.subtitle: An adventurous SUV for active lifestyles.
gb.description: When it was introduced in 1994, the Toyota RAV4 pioneered a new market segment known as 'the crossover SUV.' Featuring a compact body with high ground clearance, this model won followers around the world, entering its 5th generation in 2018. The Adventure grade offers rugged off-road styling, and features a custom grille and skid-plate bumpers, along with 19-inch wheel rims. The 2L inline-4 Dynamic Force Engine is coupled to a Direct Shift-CVT to offer both smooth acceleration and high fuel efficiency.

gb.subtitle: A best-selling Land Cruiser with a 24-year production run.
gb.description: Offering outstanding all-terrain performance and reliability, the Land Cruiser has become the world's favourite off-road vehicle. Introduced in 1960, the 3rd generation '40' model also provides a comfortable on-road experience. The 2-door hard-top model featured here houses a 3.9L F-model petrol engine, mated to a part-time four-wheel drivetrain. However, its popularity grew even further in 1974 with the addition of a 3L B-model diesel engine. The series would prove to be a massive hit, remaining in production until 1984.

gb.subtitle: This track-ready ELANTRA is brought to you by the letter ‘N’.
gb.description: Introduced as the high-performance model of the 7th generation ELANTRA, the ELANTRA N was developed to embody the N brand philosophy of 'making cornering fun.' Equipped with a 2L turbo engine capable of producing 276.1 BHP of power and 40.0 kgfm of torque, it has a 0-62.1 mph acceleration speed of just 5.3 seconds despite its front-wheel drive layout. The car is available in 6-speed manual or 8-speed DCT transmission variants. Furthermore, its running gear features electronically controlled dampers and an eLSD, along with a heavy-duty braking system.

gb.subtitle: Polestar's flagship model combines sustainability with high-performance.
gb.description: Created by the Scandinavian electric car brand Polestar, the Polestar 5 is an all-wheel drive electric saloon featuring a 5 m long streamlined body with a glass roof that stretches to the rear of the car. It is powered by a dual-motor setup featuring a motor on each of the front and rear axles. The Performance model is able to produce 650 kW/1,015 Nm. The 800V electrical architecture can use 350 kW fast-charging, allowing the battery to charge from 10 to 80% in just 22 min. The maximum range is 416.3 miles under WLTP mode testing (dual-motor version).

gb.subtitle: A midship sports car with a revolutionary V6 + PHEV system.
gb.description: The 296 GTB is a plug-in hybrid that also features the first V6 engine since the Dino series. The smallest model in the current Ferrari lineup, its classically designed body is an homage to the classic 250 LM of the 1960s. It seats a 3L V6 twin-turbo engine in the midship position, which combined with the 123 kW electric motor produces a total system output of 830 horsepower. Able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in just 2.9s and reach a top speed of 205.1 mph this car boasts performance worthy of the Ferrari name.

gb.subtitle: An elegant GT3 machine also known as the 'Racing Queen'.
gb.description: A GT3 machine developed from the 296 GTB, the 296 GT3 has removed the plug-in hybrid system from the road car to become a purebred racing car using only the 600-horsepower V6 twin-turbo engine. The car is produced by world-class racing constructor Oreca, which handles everything from chassis construction to assembly to customer service. After its unveiling at the 24 Hours of Spa in July 2022, it showcased its high-performance racing ability by recording 100 race victories in under two years.

gb.subtitle: A V8 version of the GT original formula car.
gb.description: The F3500-A was created as a love letter to early 1990s F1, and the F3500-B continues this lineage. The biggest change is the powertrain. While the F3500-A features a V12 engine, the F3500-B uses a compact lightweight V8. A V8 would usually produce less power, but this engine is able to reach up to 13,800 rpm, producing over 700.2 BHP as a result. The F3500-B also features 3 different front wings for the high-nose.

gb.subtitle: Renault's rebellious minivan carries an F1 engine.
gb.description: 10 years after the debut of Europe's first minivan came the Renault Espace F1, an unprecedented monster machine. The 'RS4' 3.5L V10 engine from the 1992 F1 championship winning FW14B is mounted in the centre of the body, which is now made of aluminium and carbon fibre. Producing 788 BHP, the car is able to accelerate from 0-62.1 mph in 2.8s, reaching a top speed of 196.4 mph. This car was also driven on an actual circuit by F1 driver Alain Prost among others.
